description:
Perfect for what it is. A cheap and fast family-run restaurant serving decent Vietnamese street food. Obviously there are much higher-end Vietnamese places in town, but if you want some quick pho or bun that tastes pretty good and uses fresh ingredients, go here.

Garlics noodles are tasty. Five spice chicken is good, too.
author: Jay B.

description:
I've been eating take out from here about once a week for the last year. The consistency of it in my rotation says something. 

 It isn't the *best* brisket pho I've ever had but, it's a perfectly passable pho for when you need pho and are in the north of the city. 

Recently, the vegetable bags have been wonky though. No jalapeno. Brown sprouties. A couple times absent entirely. Hope everything's okay Ly people! 

Overall a comforting pho bowl.
author: Liss T.

description:
I was in town for a short time and my motel was located on Lombard. Got back to my motel near 8:00 pm. And was looking for something warm and fast.

Search of Yelp showed many options in walking distance, so I decided to go for some Pho.

Ly's is a relatively small place, seats about 25-30.  Got to my seat after about 2 minute wait. The place was quite clean and had three flat screens, two with Thursday night football and one with professional vacation videos of Vietnam.  TVs are important to me as I often find myself dining alone while on business.

Ordered pork rolls and combination pho with Thai tea. Rolls came out quick. Tender, chewy, lots or herbs and the pork was tender and delicious.  Then came the pho. Portion was generous, meats were tasty. I especially liked the tripe, it was cooked so that much of the usual rubberyness (sp?) Was gone and replaced with an al-dente pasta texture.  The broth , which we all know is the real star of a good pho, was hot and delicious.  Could have enjoyed it as is, but I like some spice in mine so as usual I added some chili paste and Sriracha.  The only (very minor) thing was that the broth lacked a little salt, but was remedied by my adding the spicy stuff.

The staff was quick and attentive.  All three of the floor staff knew all that was going on with each table and were helping each other.

No parking other than the street as is usual in the city.

Overall, an excellent experience. Would return if given a chance.
author: Matt F.

description:
Not many Viet places I've dabbled in the city serve Bun Rieu. I was so ecstatic to see it on their menu, and boy, was I a happy customer. Delicious, and they don't skimp! Tons of flavor with the tomato/crab base soup, and lots of yummy fish cake, fried tofu, and minced crab/shrimp. Well done!

Also tried the garlic noodles which were super chewy and garlicky. I didn't feel indigested like I do when it comes to garlic, and the noodles weren't oily at all! 

Service was attentive and food came out fast. 

Only downside is it's all the way in the Marina (lucky those in the Marina) but definitely worth the trip! This might be one of my new favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the city ^_^
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I've come here twice and me being willing to walk 40 minutes one way is testament to how solid this place is. 

The standard beef pho was a nice portion size, and didn't taste artificial, which is really hard to find nowadays. The crab paste noodle somehow had a bigger noodle portion than the pho, but I'm not complaining. Also really tasty, this is probably the thing I'll order here from now on.

The service was decent, wait staff was polite and prompt. 

I'm giving 4 stars because I've had better pho, but Ly's is still really good.
author: Calvin Z.

description:
[Summary]
Got hungry after touring Golden State Bridge.  Found this place, and it was decent.  This place is just another average Vietnamese restaurant.  They serve pho, vermicelli, and rice dishes, as well as typical appetizers.  I'm sated, so this place did its job.

[Location]
It is located on Lombard St.  Chevron and Shell gas stations are across the street from it.

[Interior and Atmosphere]
It's casual.  It's not spacious, but not cramped either.

[Food]
Shaken Filet Mignon: Your typical Bò Lúc Lác dish, served with white rice and accompanied my a fried sunny-side-up egg and lettuce, spinach, chopped onions, bell peppers, tomatoes and cucumbers.  Sweet fish sauce on the side.  The beef was kinda rare on the inside, which was my first time eating this dish rare.  There's not much difference in taste compared to fully cooked beef.  The egg was charred and crispy on the bottom, and still runny on top.  I enjoyed the egg a lot.  The onions could have been replaced with sweet onions--they were somewhat bitter.  Could have given me a bit more beef, too.

[Service]
Didn't take our orders with pencil and paper.  I actually asked for Shaken Tiger Prawns, but she gave me Filet Mignon, which is fine.  I didn't mind.  Refilled our water often.
author: Huy N.

description: Delicious, home-cooked feel. Quick service for to-go.
author: Mingming C.

description:
I really liked this place.  We had the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles and grilled pork over rice.  I liked both dishes, they were affordable, and the portions were decent.  The staff was nice and friendly.  My friend wanted to try the Bun Rieu, but wasn't sure if it would be good, so maybe something to try next time if we are in the area.

The garlic noodles were pretty good and there was a nice pile of them.  None of the meat was overly fatty which I appreciated.
author: Ty C.

description:
I don't know if there is something wrong with me, but I felt like this pho place was very very average. I was attracted to this place because of the five star reviews. 

I ordered the Five Spice Chicken Pho ($10.75) because it sounded cool and I have never seen five spice chicken inside a bowl of pho before. 

When I received my food, however, I noticed the five spice chicken was placed on the side and my bowl was literally full of noodles and tons of onions. There were so many fried onions that it made the soup taste very sweet. They were also very overwhelming too. I started picking out the onions just so I can taste the noodles more. 

The chicken was great and was very crunchy on the outside. However, it did not match well with the pho. I am not sure why this place is called "Five Spice Chicken Pho" when it should really be "Pho with Five Spice Chicken on the Side."

Although the chicken was fine, I probably don't plan to come back.
author: Kristina M.

description: Pleasantly surprised that the pho is actually not bad! Broth a bit sweet but had good depth to it. Meat was good too. Bun rieu had good flavor also. Would definitely come back!
author: Vivian D.

description:
Pho in SF on a chilly spring is pretty awesome! After the Giants game, the wifey wanted something warm and healthy so she chose this place. Don't know the neighborhood, but it was really close to Lombard St. and Fort Mason. 

Decor-Plain, as plain as can be. This place is a hole in the wall, but it was clean and tables were neatly arranged. Nothing else to say. 

Service-they greeted es with a slime and checked on us once while we dined in. 

Food-I was would say it was ordinary Pho, nothing that really blew my mind away. Rare beef was tender and rare. Rolls were freshly cooked and were good. 

Overall, pretty basic restaurant and food.
author: German R.

description:
I wanted to like this place, but was disappointed.  I ordered via Postmates so I can't say anything about the service.  I love pho and due to the raving reviews, I thought it would be a hit...however the food was only mediocre.  

POSTMATES
Pho ga
Pandan leaf waffle-  soggy by the time it got to me
Five spice chicken rice plate

3.5 stars.  Maybe I needed to get the bun rieu or the five spice chicken *pho, but I found my food to be bland.
author: Lyn C.

description: This is the first Vietnamese restaurant I have tried in SF, I was very satisfied with the service and the food. The dinning area was very clean and inviting. I will prob be back for a second round soon.
author: Elliott D.

description:
I've been going here at least once a week for the past year for my bun rieu fix - they do it really well here, service is impeccable, staff are super friendly.  I also order all the time for delivery via postmates.  Very clean, very unassuming and excellent food.

My favorite cuisine is Vietnamese and this is by far my favorite Viet restaurant in the city (and I've been to alot ot them!)
author: Clarissa P.

description: I like having a reliable sit-down or take-out spot that covers cravings for pho or their amazing garlic noodles with shaken beef! It always hits the spot and the staff is welcoming and accommodating. They were even nice and forgiving when my 1-year old made a huge mess while he was eating (he wants to do it himself these days). It's been one of our go-to spots for years and will continue to be for as long as we're in the hood!
author: Alex N.

description:
Delicious, affordable pho in a modern setting with attentive customer service.

I was compelled to write a review because I wanted to steer others to the Beef Satay Pho.  I've never come across this dish before, and it was truly an experience - it was as if some yummy, unchaste pho and a promiscuous bowl of spicy ramen had a quick tryst and the resultant offspring was this beautiful bastard of a meal.
author: Raman M.

description:
My coworker told me that she puts chicken in her beef broth pho and although it's simple my mind was blown because I never thought to ask for this ??!!!! 

So... I quickly checked my bookmarks and found Ly's and skiddoodled my way on over.

I got a combo pho and added chicken for a couple bucks extra. So so good and I didn't have to add any hoisen sauce which I typically have to do. They were very generous with the portions of meat as well.

Although it's kind of out of the way for me I look forward to returning.

author: Rod M.

description:
I recently had lunch here and was not impressed. The pho was underwhelming and consisted mostly of noodles with very little chicken or flavor. We also ordered the shrimp summer rolls and green papaya salad. The salad was the best item. The rolls were also heavy on the noodles and didn't have any herb inside but basil. I make them all the time and include basil, mint and cilantro and it makes a big impact. 
The pho was not flavorful enough, same with the rolls.
I would chose another places next time.
author: Amanda C.

description:
This is one of the best pho in SF. The real differentiator between Ly's and other place's is the pho broth. Which is so much more richer and flavorful without being salty. 
I usually order the beef pho with rare beef, brisket and tendon, it was amazingly flavorful. They have great food rice noodles with a good texture that will allow you to slurp to easily. 

This time my boyfriend ordered the king tiger shrimp vermicelli noodle salad. This salad was also good, the grilled Shrimp was flavored well. And provided a good texture compared to the vermicelli noodles. 

This restaurant's atmosphere is casual and unassuming.
author: Demy T.

description:
Near my job and best of all they have boba drinks!!
Parking is an issue so I will recommend order by phone so is ready to pick up!
author: Liliana P.

description:
Gonna update my review to 5 stars because Ly's has officially proven to be the best pho in all the northern neighborhoods (pac heights, marina, cow hollow). 

I stopped by for lunch yesterday because San Francisco is currently under blizzard conditions and a hot bowl of soup sounded amazing. Seriously, winter has come to our fair city. Anyway, I ordered a bowl of the pho ga (chicken soup) for $9.75 and it really hit the spot! The broth is super clean and has nice amount of fried onions that make the broth stand out. It's all white meat chicken in the soup and the noodles are the thin glass kind. Delicious. 

As for the space itself, it's clean inside. You know that they are using better ingredients than most hole in the wall pho shops (which I love) but, it makes for a pleasant eating experience.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Came here after craving non-stop Pho all week. I haven't been feeling meat, so I ordered vegetables in the beef broth. It was sooooooo good! Good pho is all about the broth, and they did a great job infusing the signature flavors you can typically taste from the various use of spices. Lots of fresh and crunchy veggies and also a few blocks of fried tofu.

The portion was great, I can usually finish an entire bowl but this time I had some to take home.

My BF ordered the Five Spice Chicken Pho- it looked delicious but not gluten-free (I could be wrong though, it might be worth asking) so I didn't try it. The chicken came on the side to retain crispness- looks like it was grilled then fried maybe? Anyway, my BF said it was delicious and added some good flavor to the pho. Wish I could try it!

We also got a couple iced coffees. They were delicious, that nice desserty sweetness you get in Vietnamese iced coffee. They weren't the type that come out slowly dripping, but that's not a big deal to me. I don't care for the dramatic anticipation of a coffee after it slowly finishes dripping 10 minutes later.
author: Chanson F.

description:
I loved the pho here! I've only been here once and enjoyed my five spice chicken pho.

I could honestly eat that chicken all day. The only thing I would do different is not put my chicken in the soup... I know, I know, you're thinking what's the point of getting chicken pho? However, when you add the five spice chicken to the soup, it recooks the delicious sauce and it takes away from the flavor.

I also would have given this place 5 stars, but then I found hair at the bottom of my soup (once I was done). Not a huge big deal for me, but still a little grossed out when that happens.

I can't wait to try the other dishes! Before I write this review I made the mistake of viewing the other photos from this place and I caught myself drooling... oops.

Also, as a side note, the staff here are really nice . I probably should have told them about the hair in my soup, I'm sure they wouldn't have been annoyed to bring me another one.
author: Gita r.

description:
Went here for dinner after a long day of driving around. Seemed to have good reviews and was craving pho so we decided to go here. 

Pros:
Good pho and the garlic noodles are pretty good!
Have a bunch of stuff on the menu that I would love to try. 

Cons: 
They served us warm water ( I don't know if that's intentional? But later they refilled it with cold water so...)
They forgot to put in our orders for our appitizers, probably because they don't write down the orders , so we had to eat the "appitizers" with the main course.

To wrap it all up, good stuff but they staff just sorta made my review go down. 
For me it would more be a 3.6 than a 4.00 but yelp can't show a 3.6 rating...
If the staff was better it would definitely be a 4.5 rating!
author: Nathan N.

description: I love this place. It's very unassuming but consistently serves up yummy Vietnamese food. The five spice chicken is delicious, the fresh shrimp rolls are predictably great, and the beef pho is exactly what you need to cure a hangover/a cold. All of the friends I've introduced to this place end up becoming regulars! If you're looking for casual sit down Vietnamese outside of the richmond distract, make this your go to.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Finally a place in SF that does pho right, this place is my new favorite place for pho in the city. They serve a range of Vietnamese cuisine, but I came for the pho and happy to say I wasn't disappointed. 
Ordered the pho with rare beef, brisket, and meatballs. Came out quickly and all the sides (lime, basil, jalapeño, sprouts) were fresh. The pho broth tasted meaty and not over salted like a lot of places. What I really like about the pho was that I was really well balanced. The right amount of noodles and meat. They did not skimp on the meat like a lot of places do which made me happy. The place itself is small but the service was fast which makes up for anything lacking. Also got the Thai iced tea which was pretty standard and ok. The potstickers were ok as well, crispy with a nice dipping sauce. Glad to have finally found a place in the city to go for my pho cravings
author: Peter P.

description:
I came here the other day to pick up food to go. I ordered the five spice chicken garlic noodle and the grilled pork vermicelli. 

The five spice chicken garlic noodle cane with steamed broccoli. The chicken was flavorful, the skin was crispy. The noodles were well seasoned and you can taste the buttery flavor. 

The grilled pork vermicelli came with a side of salad. The grilled pork was perfectly flavored and delicious. I actually wish that they provided a little more of the pork. 

Overall, I really enjoyed the food here. And I would definitely come back to try other dishes.
author: Andrea G.

description: Best pho in the neighborhood! Can't believe I just found this place. If you haven't tired it you are missing out! The rare beef pho is sooo good!! I also love the beef garlic noodles. The beef is marinated in something magical!
author: Kristi K.

description: One of my favorite marina spots for a low cost meal! I love to just get the $7 side of garlic noodles because they are so filling and cheap! Also love their pho and noodle dishes.
author: Baylee R.

description: Great customer service and food is served rather quickly.  Pho is ok.  Spring rolls are ok.  Vermicelli salad is great.  The place is clean and the price is fair.  Overall it's above average for me.
author: Andy C.

description: One lazy morning, I didn't feel like driving outside of the marina for pho. I decided to try this place out and I've got to say.... it was pretty good but expensive. The pho and bon rieu were both on point. Noodles, broth, and meat content all wonderful. The garlic noodles were about average. It could use some work (maybe better noodles and making it less soggy). Everything was great until I tasted the water and the smell of wet towel coming from the the utensils/table hovered. Huge turn off for me. If the food tastes good but the smell of wet towel is getting into my nose.... it won't make it a great combo. Food was good though!
author: Monica L.

description:
I have been here twice due to the sky high reviews and it is just okay. The egg rolls are not good, pho is pretty good and the crab paste soup is a bit sweeter then my moms- but since my mom is farther away, this place is okay.

I just would not go back.
author: Tina L.

description:
my mom was craving for noodle soup when we visiting SF. I found this place on Yelp due to the high review. 

Overall experience was not bad. Food is tasty and within decent price range. server is friendly. food portion is big. I wish they could server transitional Vietnamese pork chop as a side dish.
author: Matt B.

description: I had dinner here today with my mom . I was very disappointed. We didn't like the food especially the papaya salad . I eat a lot of Vietnamese and Thai food but this was not good . Service was also disappointed .
author: Miok C.

description:
Stopped by around 8pm on a Saturday night. It was not super busy. There was no wait. Maybe 4-5 tables were occupied. Food comes out relatively quickly. 

Papaya salad - 7/10
A very standard papaya salad. Different in that you pour the sauce onto the papaya yourself and mix everything together. Got the tiger shrimp -- wish they had put just a bit more into the salad. The slicr the shrimps in half to make it seem like there is more initially. Sauce was nice and sweet. Could have done it without the pungent red onion slices though. I found them quite distracting. 

Shaking beef garlic noodle - 8.5/10
Garlic noodles are well seasoned and bouncy, just the way I like them. Lovely flavor in the sauce you can dip the noodles into. The beef was perfectly cooked, medium rare! Lots of flavor. Perfect with the noodles. 

Beef pho - 8/10
Very flavorful and meaty broth. Good amount of noodle. Tasty slices of beef. Glad they didn't put any onion in it, though it could have used some more cilantro. Solid bowl of pho without artificial flavor. 

Imperial rolls - 2/10
Egg rolls in disguise. Tiny. And is there potato inside? Not what I was expecting. They should have used rice (not wheat flour) wraps.
author: J P.

description:
Wonderful Phô soup and kind, pleasant service. I recommend them highly. THIS will be our new traditional restaurant to visit when in town.

We live in Roseville, CA. Last Friday, we took visiting family friends to San Francisco for sightseeing. We found this place on Yelp and went to try. Our party of 5 people also comes with a service dog (gorgeous, purebred Golden Retriever). 6 months ago, we had a very bad experience with Golden Flower in Chinatown and were now very wary of anti-service dog sentiments. However, we experienced absolutely no ill sentiments or detrimental effects of our service dog that stayed under the table quietly the entire time.

The service was fast. The establishment is simple, clean, and suited for families. The rare beef phô I ordered was delicious. The accompanying bean sprouts and thai basil were very fresh. We are all foodies, and my wife (who wasn't too thrilled in the past with other phô except a friend's homemade one from years back) COULD NOT STOP RAVING about her tiger shrimp phô. My 13-yr old son also had the rare beef phô and almost finished it. AMAZING! The server was very accommodating and kind. We took our leftovers with us and promised ourselves we would be back again many times. The last few days my wife (a thin petite person) has continued to rave about this place saying that she wakes up in the morning with thoughts of this phô on her mind.
author: Alex N.

description: I got one of the vegetarian pho noodle bowls and it came with a decent amount of veggies! The tofu was ok, and the soup was the same. I would say it's an average bowl of pho for the price point, but I've had better around the bay.
author: Annie T.

description: Very fast service and excellent pho. The papaya salad, 5 spice chicken, and crab pho were all great.  The broth was really flavorful for both and they didn't skip on the meat or condiments. Really casual place with great prices.
author: Anjali P.

description: We love the garlic noodles from Lys. I can't bring myself to order pho to go since I don't want hot soup in a plastic container. But I love everything else about the place including how low key the restaurant is - hard to find a restaurant like that in the Marina!
author: Ashley S.

description:
Great casual Vietnamese spot on Lombard.

They seem to be known most for the crab paste soup so order it.

Crab paste soup ($10.75): great flavor and spot on enjoyable

Chicken pho ($9.75): great rich flavor, not too salty, and I loved that it was all white meat!  None of the fatty, yuck when some places put in the dark meat with skin etc. It's the thin noodles, not the thick ones you get at Turtle Tower.  I love my Turtle Tower, but I might just have to mix this one in the rotation now because I quite enjoyed it.  And they have both sriracha and hoisin sauce on the table...

Fresh pork spring roll ($7): simple but tasty.  It tasted like the grilled the pork just before they rolled it since the pork was still warm.  It has bean sprouts in it (not my thing).  It comes with the fish sauce, but if you ask for peanut sauce, they will bring you a side of peanut sauce too, which was really tasty.

There's a ton of other things on the menu, like 5 spice chicken garlic noodle...but will have to come back to try it out.

Looks like they do a lot of interesting non-alcoholic drinks like fresh lemonade, thai iced team, young coconut with meat in it.


Single sex bathroom in the back.

Accepts credit cards.

If they leave the front door open the front few tables can get a little cold, so you might want to move to a table further in the back if they won't close the door.
author: Traci H.

description:
This is my new fav Vietnamese place in SF located in the Marina out of all places! I ordered a green papaya salad with grilled beef - so fresh and sauce on the side so the papaya was "al dente" to perfection (I hate it when the papaya is soggy!)

I also order a rare beef pho and the sauce was excellent. The veggies (bean sprouts, mint leaves) were fresh and you can tell everything is made to order. 

I purposely drive here from Japantown to eat here! Love it!
author: Avant R.

description: Great off-the-beaten family Vietnamese place!! Veggie rolls and spice chicken vermicelli bowl. The virgin Lychee Mojoto was incredible. We walked from pier 39 because too crowded. It was a hike! Grab a bike cab or Uber.
author: Susan C.

description:
Review is only for the to- go part. 
We ordered a bun rieu and a pho to go and they definitely give you good portions. The flavors of the bun rieu and pho are pretty on point, given that this place is the marina and we were slightly concerned that it would be catered not to asians. 
definitely would come back here again.
author: Jessica H.

description: Good broth and clear is what i look for in a pho... this place meet my standard... crowded too...
author: Michael P.

description: I love discovering new tasty pho places. Honestly, it's hard to mess pho up. But I had date night here last week and was pretty blown away. We had the five spice chicken pho, which was really flavorful; the tiger shrimp vermicelli, which was delicious; and imperial rolls- bomb as well! Service was pretty awesome for a pho restaurant too- they came about three times to fill up our water cups. My boyfriend was not as impressed as I was but I truly noticed the flavors in their food. Check this spot out if you're in the Marina. AND they had good prices!
author: Dara S.

description: If had take-out here several times and although the garlic noodles, vermicelli, and other dishes are very good, the Pho here is great!  I like to order the two item Pho with rare beef (obviously not cooked) and the brisket (cooked).  To-go orders are well packaged, and you essentially assemble the dish at home.  I'm not sure what makes this so good, it must be the broth, but it's now become crave worthy for me, especially on an especially cold day / night.
author: Tom G.

description:
I love this mom & pop Vietnamese place. Their garlic noodles and pho are delicious! They're quick, kind and affordable. 
Definitely not a fancy place but great for staple, yummy food
author: Leigh B.

description: hard to find a decent vietnamese place outside of the little saigon area but Ly's hits the spot when you're craving pho or a noodle dish!! Really love the comfort of having this place nearby. Usually a good level of meat to pho ratio except for the last time i visited .. :-/
author: Felicia C.

description: I frequent Ly's at least twice a week. It is everything I've ever wanted in a pho place. Love the 5 spice chicken pho. I'll get the garlic noodles as well if I'm feelin it.
author: Connor H.

description:
I visited this establishment with my kids on a Sunday night in March, and it filled right up! I had the 5 spice chicken pho. I believe an error led them to serve my chicken on the side (I saw a girl at another table asking where her chicken was, and saw them look at me) but it was a happy accident. The skin was perfect, and I got to share some with the kids. They had the meatball pho, and it was good, but didn't compare to mine. It hit the spot on a cold evening.

The place is pretty small; a group of 10 came in, and it really seemed to rattle the staff. They seated the group at 3 different tables.
author: Celia A.

description:
We tried to go here for an early lunch on Wednesday, May 10th.  The hours were posted at Ly's in opening at 11 AM and we arrived at a little after 11 the doors were locked.  What made it really bad is there was a woman inside that acknowledged we were there and went into the kitchen never to return and then a man came out and ignored us.  We watched three people or 15 minutes work in kitchen acting like we were not there until we finally left!  

If you post your hours at a certain time, then open the doors.  Do not ignore customers who are waiting when they should be inside due to your being late to open the open the doors!  Obviously, we have no idea when they really open, very disappointed and won't be back.
author: Ron P.

description:
Delicious food, great service. I had the vegetarian pho and tiger shrimp, my wife had the chicken pho. Huge portions, satisfying, and the setting is laid back. 

Plus the boba Thai iced tea w boba was excellent.
author: Jon G.

description: Proper pho. This is now my favorite SF pho place. Bonus is the cleanliness and friendly staff. Tiger prawn pho is a must.
author: Eric O.

description: Best Vietnamese food- imperial roll salad is my favorite, but the pho is solid as well. Spring rolls are premade in containers but great.
author: Alanna P.

description:
Had a friend visiting from Hong Kong and she was craving real Viet pho. I didn't order it, but she was very happy with her five spice chicken pho! I ordered the grilled pork noodles for myself, and it was alright. Pork was pretty salty but noodles were kinda bland, so they balanced each other out. Plate came with fish sauce that wasn't really necessary, but I never say no to fish sauce! 

The location itself is decent too. Parking was available a couple blocks down. Inside is clean and simple - pretty much what you would expect from a Vietnamese restaurant. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's a place I'd feel comfortable taking my traditional Viet parents to.
author: Jenny T.

description: Hm this was ok. We got here early and the place began to fill up. Who doesn't want soup on a rainy day and for cheap? Service was good. I always complain when the rice noodles all bunch up. The meat combo was full of stuff which is a plus. We may return if we're in the area but our go to is Yummy Yummy.
author: Guisela L.

description:
I love Ly's. I only eat here for Vietnamese food. Their bun rieu is spot on and tastes like how my mom makes it at home. They also deliver which is great. I can easily spend $40 on myself because the food here is delicious. 

I've also eaten in and service is great! Love them!
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I've only ever gotten the chicken pho here but it's bomb and inexpensive! This place is less than two blocks from my house so super convenient. I usually place an order on yelp and go pick it up 15 minutes later. It's very flavorful and a good large portion for about $10. It's definitely become a staple for me.
author: Jenna G.

description: So I came here already thinking it was just another place.... well dang Gina I left SHOCKED.... seriously shocked on how good my Bun Rieu was. Perhaps the best bun rieu I've had in a long time, besides my home cooked version. Yeah that's right... I was shocked... now the reason why I didn't give it a 5 star, well the lettuce was missing from the garnish that's suppose to be given with your soup. Other than that I AM STILL SHOCKED HOW GOOD IT WAS. I think this is the best thing on their menu everyone!
author: Dang D.

description: Found this place by looking at yelp when my partner and I visited SF for my birthday weekend.   Parking can be a little tough during peak hours.  We drove around for 20 min looking for parking.  Suggest you use Uber or  Lyft if you don't want to deal with parking.    Food was very good. Probably one of the better Vietnamese food we have tasted.  I had the beef broth pho and hubby had the chicken broth pho.  Both were very delicious, broth were very well done and season very well.  Portions were large.   We also had spring rolls and they were super fresh, made to order.   We also tried the chicken wing and it was also good.    Highly recommend you give this place a try if your in the area if want cheap good food.
author: Steve C.

description: If you're gonna order pho I would get the beef satay! I think the menu was fairly priced for the quality and serving size. I very much enjoyed my chicken pho (considering I was very sick and congested  it was quite soothing). The place itself was clean and simplistic. Quick service and easy going staff! I would come back
author: Leslie T.

description: This is a small Vietnamese restaurant that's clean, very casual and has fast service. The food however is not that tasty. Its just okay. Also, I thought it was interesting for the meals to be served with eggs because my favorite Vietnamese restaurants' meals do not have sunny side up eggs with them. However, the combination is fine. The cold tea drink was good though. The server was nice and friendly which is a plus. Overall, my dining experience was average. I don't think I'll be back to this restaurant since there are many other options in the San Francisco area.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
3.5 stars

Came here Monday night with bf as it's in his neighborhood and walking distance from his place. We both got the standard pho, mine was with rare beef and tripe. They didn't put very good pieces of tripe or much of it in my bowl. The rare beef was meh, kind of stringy/tough/dry. Noodles were yum and broth was okay though.

It's good but not anywhere close to Pho 2000 or Kevin's Noodle House.
author: Mimi T.

description: No frills joint with Vietnamese food that hits the spot. Reasonable prices for a restaurant in the Marina though street parking can be a bit tight at times. Menu is limited but the items available are done well. Basic array of Vietnamese noodles (pho and garlic noodles but include tasty favorites including crab paste noodles and beef satay noodles). Their meats are well seasoned and savory, not too salty, and most dishes come with fish sauce for those that are more sodium inclined. The pho is solid, not stellar but will definitely hit the spot late nights. The beef satay noodles are in a dark peanut flavored broth that has a nice level of heat to it. Crab paste noodles are another favorite with a seafood broth ladened with fish cakes and tomatoes. Recommend a side of garlic noodles so you don't miss out on the buttery goodness!
author: David L.

description: I came here with a girlfriend for pho on a rainy Friday night. I ended up ordering for take-out, 'cause I wasn't feeling well. I haven't had any pho that was great so far in SF, yet. But, I had this pho and it was pretty delicious actually. I would totally come back and have more pho or try other items on the menu.
author: Marie D.

description:
Nice and friendly service. But The food was just ok at best, and kinda pricey for what it was. 

For pho ga, Turtle Tower is my favorite for both portion, price and quality. Here, a few shreds of white meat and overdone thin noodles. The broth was wholly unsatisfying, flavorless as if a bit watered down.

I had the imperial rolls too. They were better than the pho, but one was much darker in color than the other two which WA a bit disconcerting.

I would say it ranks among the lesser pho places I've been to in all respects, portion price and flavor .
author: Henry Y.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night to meet a friend for dinner.  Chicken Pho is one of my most favorite things to eat.  At first when I came here I thought this place can't be better than Vung Tau in Milpitas or San Jose.  I ordered the chicken pho.  The soup is absolutely tasty.  I usually add all kinds of hot sauce and hoisin sauce to the soup if I felt like it didn't taste quite like the way I like it.  I didn't need to add anything to it.  It was just right.  

chicken pho is always great to have if you are sick or not feeling well.  If I am ever in the area I will stop by here again.  Staff was also very nice and helpful.  Price point is reasonable for San Francisco but would be consider on the high side if you ate pho on San Jose.  Overall, delicious pho!  No need to add any of that hot stuff or hoisin sauce to it. 

Worth a try if you are in the area for sure!
author: Alice T.

description:
Stopped by here for a light dinner on Friday night. Service was very fast and decently priced, however I felt like the environment/the area they're in is a bit sketch. i don't spend much time in the Marina so I'm not too familiar with this area. I use to think the Marina is very expensive and high-end but I guess not all of it! That probably explains why this restaurant is able to be priced so well. I got the crab paste noodle soup and my bf got the pho. His pho portion was quite small but mine was definitely pretty large. We probably could've shared one of the crab paste noodle bowls and been full. 

I would say Ly's is not a bad option if you live in the area and want something cheap and fast, but for vietnamese cuisines in the city I think I prefer Sunflower.
author: Annie Z.

description: Best Pho in town. The Broccoli in Oyster Sauce is crunchy, garlicky with a slight funk (in a good way) from the oyster sauce. You will not be dissapointed.
author: Jon M.

description: Excellent Vietnamese restaurant in Marina. Ordered five spice chicken with vermicelli noodle. Chicken was grilled perfectly w/ lots of flavor from the pour over sauce. I dont know what's in it, but I love any vinegary based sauces. Decent iced Vietnamese coffee. Service is friendly and water refilled without asking. Not usually packed during late lunch on weekends.
author: Thomas L.

description: Always order the vermicelli salad; always order it when I'm not feeling pho. This restaurant does it GREAT! Presentation was good before I mixed it up, the grilled pork is sooooo flavorful and soft than most other pho places that grill their pork to a crisp, and the vinaigrette that you pour over isn't sour or bland. Overall, easily 4-5 stars and definitely coming back soon for pho!
author: Anderson H.

description:
I'm not in this area very often, but my friend and I were looking for something quick and casual to eat before going to an event at Fort Mason. This place turned out to be perfect. It was cold and drizzly that night, so I got myself some soul-warming soup noodles. The restaurant is pretty bare in terms of decor and ambience (think typical, casual Asian restaurant and those stereotypical cheap wooden chairs with seat padding), but they do have a couple flat-screen TVs mounted up on the walls. I got there just after 6pm on a Friday night, and the place was completely empty, but by 7pm, it was starting to fill up.

I was debating between the standard pho or the crab paste soup noodles (bun rieu), and decided to be adventurous and pick the latter since I'd actually never had it before! Service was incredibly fast - they brought me my noodles in under 5 minutes! The soup was steaming, piping hot and smelled delicious. It wasn't quite what I expected, but it was pretty good. The broth was cooked with tomatoes to balance out the slightly seafood-y taste and is a bit heavier than that of pho, but still very clear and not too oily. It had a few pieces of fried tofu and fish / crab paste pieces in it, and the vermicelli wasn't mushy or overcooked.

Not sure I'll ever be back again simply because it's so out of the way for me, but, overall the food is good for the price.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Stopped here for a quick dinner before heading to a Yelp event at Fort Mason. It's probably one of the best quick eats in the area.

I ordered the butter garlic noodles with five spice chicken. At 6:40, the restaurant was quite empty and so my food came out after about 5-10min. 

The portion size is decent for the price. I was regretting eating it all once I stood up. The garlic noodles were savory and flavorful though much too dry. There was a hint of butter but I think they were probably stir fried for too long. That being said, I did like the fact that they used thicker noodles because the chewiness was more satisfying to eat. The best part of the dish though was the chicken, which was full of flavor and despite being fried, didn't have a really greasy taste to it. I would certainly get the chicken again if I'm get in the area. Lastly, wish they would have had a bit more broccoli... Don't advertise veggies as a part of the dish if there's only going to be two florets!
author: Liza X.

description:
Pho in the Marina?! 

Pho-realz. I ain't pho-king with you.

* you knew that was coming right? *

We were pho-rtunate (ok, I'll stop) to find this place since we got an instant craving for pho after my core40 workout in LPH. And we all know there isn't any good pho places there!

I loved my grilled shrimp rice plate which came with a fried egg and a cup of hot chicken broth. DEELISH. And he was satisfied with the taste and portion size of his beef pho. Granted this is the Marina, prices for pho hover around $9 and rice plates around $10.

I'd skip the so called imperial rolls next time; these were more like the Chinese version of egg rolls. 

It's great to know that we can count on a reliable Vietnamese place in the heart of the Marina. We'll be back pho sho  ;-)
author: Janice C.

description:
The pho was warm and filling here. I ordered the Chicken Pho and it was well-prepared and the broth was refreshing and balanced (though they did kind of skimp on the amount of meat they serve you).

The Shrimp Fresh Spring Rolls were also pretty amazing and served with a tasty peanut sauce. I highly recommend.
author: Enrique F.

description:
This place is pretty good. The interior design is very modern, way better than most of the vietnamese places I have been to. At least I can make sure myself feeling very comfortable with what I am eating here is clean and safe. All the dishes they serve are nicely decorated as well! I can tell the chefs put their heart into making the dishes. Good job!

One draw back is that the portions aren't that big. I have been to some places where they offer huge portion to make sure your stomach feel very satisfied after you're done, but not quite this place.
author: Judy O.

description: This place is clutch for a quick bite or takeaway when craving Vietnamese! I recommend the beef brisket pho, vermicelli with pork, or wheat noodles with five spice chicken or shrimp. Vietnamese ice coffee is like crack, in the best, non-illicit way possible.
author: Alex B.

description:
Im bias when it comes to Pho/vietnamese food. I know this place cater toward american since the menu was in english when i came here for dinner with my mom. This place is probably chinese since one of the workers were speaking chinese in the back and with some chinese decoration with a few vietnamese decoration as well. But this place is clean and they do have a few tvs.

These are the things that my mom and i got:

Imperial roll (fried egg roll)...came out hot when i first bit it. My mom thought the inside of the fried egg roll were taro and didn't taste any meat. I thought it was alright. Cost $7

Beef combo pho which cost $10...the only meat choices they had were beef, brisket, and meatballs(cut into slices). I thought its pricy when they don't give you that much meat. The broth had very light flavor. So i wasnt that satisfying with their pho. When you go to other Pho places, its usually around $7 or $8 and they usually give more than what this place give you. 

Took them awhile to bring out the dessert maybe like 15 minutes or so. which we got fried banana and ice cream...it was really good. They don't use the whole banana. Its like cut into 4 slices of bananas and fried individually. Cost $4

The staffs are friendly here
author: Julie N.

description: Chicken pho is so on point here. I get it every Sunday and they are available for delivery on postmates which is awesome for a lazy Sunday. I have eaten there and their service is great!
author: Priyanka G.

description:
3.5 stars
When the temperature drops below 60 all I want is some nice comforting Pho is warm up my belly.  My fiancé and I were both feeling a bit under the weather (holiday party weekend hangover) and with the rare chilly December day we were having Pho seemed like the perfect lunch option.  A quick yelp search in the area and I found Ly's on Lombard street so we decided to go check it out.  We arrived around 2:00 PM on a Sunday.  The restaurant was about half full when we came in and the server was cleaning up a table and sat us right away.  We were immediately given water and some menus to glance over.

Pretty much right when we sat down and I could smell the delicious Pho nearby I got hangry.  Like bad.  You know that feeling when the next day the hangover really starts kickin in and all you can think about is eating your hand off you're so hungry.  Yup. Cue that feeling.  With only one vegetarian option on the menu I knew right away I would get the veggie Pho (vegetarian broth, mushrooms, tofu, broccoli, cabbage and rice noodles) and my fiancé went for the combo (beef broth with all the meat fixins).  But when it came time to order the waitresses were nowhere to be found.  We desperately tried to get their attention. They went to every other table, taking orders, seating new guests, clearing tables. IM STARVING OVER HERE! AH! Finally, after about 10 long minutes of waiting we flagged down someone to take our order.

I guess one good thing about Pho is it is always out to your table in no time.  Shortly after we placed our order the server brought over the usual side of sprouts, lime wedges, basil and jalapeno.  The Pho arrived and I was happy to have a massive bowl of steaming hot soup to chow down on.  I was a little disappointed overall in the flavor and quality of the veggies.  Vegetarian broth for Pho is always a hit or miss for me and I felt this one to be a little flavorless. I had to add quite a bit of sriracha and basil to kick it up a bit.  Also, it was lacking in veggies.  I only got about 3 small cubes of tofu, mostly cabbage and a lot of mushrooms that had an odd spongy texture.  Overall, it did satisfy my cravings and warm me up.  But, with the super slow service and sub-par flavors, I would suggest taking a walk to the 'loin for some better Pho for us veg-heads.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
El Niño has got the best of us this weekend in the Bay Area. Heavy rains..plus my beau and I were also both sporting some sexy colds. What's the best thing to address cold, gloomy weather and runny noses? Why, Pho, of course!

Hit. The. Spot.

The establishment itself is really simple and really clean. White chairs, white walls, white tables - super minimalistic. The pho speaks for itself. I had the pho bo with rare beef. He had the brisket. It came out appropriately burn-your-tongue hot with sprouts, peppers, and too little lime. I needed to ask for more. The hoisin and hot sauces are on the table for you when you need it. 

Oh, that broth was so delicious. My problem with pho is that I feel full so fast and and I always try my damndest to finish the broth entirely, but I never do. Disappointing, I know. Good portion of beef and noodles which I did clean up. 

Anyway, top notch Vietnaemese food. We'll probably hit up this place again when we need our Vietnamese fix.

***I tried putting the correct accent mark on the word "pho", but Yelp deleted the "o" *sadface*
author: Priti K.

description:
So-so pho location. As other foodies have written, this is a good introductory pho place. It's clean and tasty and provides all of the necessities such as the side of bean sprouts, jalapenos, cilantro and lime. 

The bowls are small compared to most legit pho restaurants. I'd give the location 3 stars on this alone. 

However, they redeem themselves with the a la carte pho option as you can choose to put 2,3,4 or all of the meat options in your bowl at adjusted prices. I wish more places were like this...
author: Joshua F.

description:
Clean, spacious, fast, cheap, decent food

Stumbled in here because I was in the hood, pho was decent, but wouldn't go as far as good. Meat was a little over cooked, broth was bit bland (needed some rooster), noodles were standard. Not awesome but for $10/bowl in this area, zero complaints.

Restaurant is spacious and clean, service is good, TV's are a nice addition. All in all, a solid place to grab a bite.
author: Roger L.

description:
Best Pho I have had in a long time! All the right toppings and flavorful! Spring rolls were large and fresh with tasty peanut dipping sauce. Not elegant dining, more like a lunch room but the food made up for the simple
Interior. Clean, well presented and really delish.
author: Diane A.

description:
Ly's Vietnamese Cuisine 

Came here with a friend on a Friday evening . We shared Papaya Salad (shredded papaya,white onions, basil, carrots, peanut and house fish sauce) and Imperial Rolls(crisps fried with ground pork, taro, carrots and silver noodles) pretty good! And for entrees, we both ordered veggie pho, very delicious!

 Five stars for the food, 3 stars for service and
5 stars for ambiance. 

We are glad to have Ly's Vietnamese Cruise in the neighborhood!
author: Zexian L.

description: Awesome Vietnamese spot, my neighborhood go to for pho. My go to items are the grilled pork spring rolls and the combination beef pho! Great spot.
author: Jonah G.

description: I normally only Yelp the really good or the really bad places. And LY'S is by far one of my favorite Vietnamese places so far. From their Gyozas to the fresh spring rolls, to their Tiger prawn shrimp, or their BBQ beef rice plates. Everything is so fucking good. It's your typical mom and pop shop, but their food is awesome!!!! I love it!!!!! Highly recommend1
author: Walter P.

description:
Had a good experience dining here. There are not many Pho choices in the Marina so thanks to Ly who decided to open a restaurant here.

The BEEF PHO ($9) was great - rich and well balanced broth, the brisket beef cooked nicely while sitting in the broth. Mint and sprouts on the side.

The GRILLED SHRIMP RICE ($10) was delicious - the shrimp with a nice smokey flavor, nicely arranged on the plate with white rice and lettuce.

4 stars "only" because the starters were just okay - both the VIETNAMESE SPRING ROLL and the FRIED EGG ROLL were a bit too small for the price ($7). 

Overall a place I'd come back to.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
5 stars for the pho here! The beef broth is AMAZING - so rich and doesn't even need any sauce to be added to it. I got the beef pho combo ($10) which came with a generous serving of brisket, meatballs, and rare beef. It only comes in one size but it was more than enough for a meal. The brisket was perfectly tender and fatty. The meatballs were delicious! Next time I'm going to get just beef pho with brisket and meatballs.

The place itself is pretty large and there was plenty of seating. The service here is ridiculously nice and attentive. The free cucumber water even tastes so refreshing! We also got the spring rolls ($7) which tasted fresh. My boyfriend ordered the grilled pork vermicelli noodle bowl with imperial rolls ($12). It was a solid dish but I would definitely recommend getting the pho instead.

I'm a huge fan of this place!
author: Linda X.

description: This place is soooo delicious! The pho soup and green tea waffle are so good! I love it. I highly recomed this place. Food is awesome and the service is fast and efficient.
author: Stacy G.

description:
Best pho I've had in the city. I've tried the rare beef, brisket, spicy satay beef, and the crab noodle (bun). All of them were excellent. 

Also reasonably priced for the marina. Any more expensive and I wouldn't be able to be a regular, but at the current prices I can once a week or so. Yummm!
author: Amanda R.

description:
Hit the spot so hard after being stuck out in the cold and rain all day. Lys is not your traditional Vietnamese place, so there aren't many options of different types of meat that can go into your pho. But I feel like they have a few things that are unique to them. I ordered the crab paste noodles, by the time my food got to me (there was a mishap where the kitchen didn't see my order) my family had already finished their meals and I was extra hungry. I ate that bowl of noodles like no other. The crab paste is kind of like a giant blob? Of crab and egg I fee like. None the less it was really good. And the soup I think is a tomato paste? But I tried the pho soup from my sister and that was really good. I also was able to take a couple bite of the garlic noodles with grilled pork which was also bursting with authentic flavors.  

All in all, excellent place I can see myself craving this place and coming often if I was from here. Also not very expensive at all.
author: Angie H.

description: Got the 5 spice chicken vermicelli bowl. There were like 5 pieces of chicken and were sweeter than i would have liked. It was pretty underwhelming and won't be back again. There was a member in our party who was about 25 minutes late and they kept rudely pressing us to order. There was only one other table so Im not sure why they were in such a hurry to push us out.
author: Song K.

description: But here yesterday got some of that good Pho. Very delicious stuff. Prices dang good too.
author: Patrick H.

description: Well priced pho (expect about $8.95 for beef brisket) and it tastes great! The servers are really friendly also. Restaurant itself is strangely sterile (white tile floors, stainless steel indestructible cups for water) but the food and service are excellent!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
I've been to Ly's a number of times and I always order the 1) garlic noodles with chicken or 2) beef pho. Simple but amazing! My fiancé likes the crab paste noodle soup, which is more unique if you're looking for something different.

Back to the five spice chicken garlic noodles -- aside from the two or three sad pieces of broccoli, this is an excellent dish. The noodles are always perfectly chewy and the chicken is juicy, packed with flavor, and crispy on the outside. It also comes with a fish sauce. The pho hits the spot too.

It's pretty amazing that there's such solid, inexpensive Vietnamese food in the Marina of all places. With that said, I've passed by a few times when there was a line out the door, but thankfully I've never had to wait.
author: Valerie L.

description: First time ordering pick-up from here, and it was yummy!! I got the garlic noodles, green papaya salad, and the spring rolls. Will def order from here again!
author: Lisa T.

description:
BEST chicken I've ever had at a Vietnamese restaurant! like for real for real! I'm Vietnamese and I never order chicken cause when beef or pork is a choice, chicken never wins!!! however, I have a kid now and sometimes when her father doesn't order something she can eat, then I have to. with that said, I ordered the garlic noodles with the 5 spice chicken. it was so delicious! the skin was crispy and the chicken was tender and just perfectly cooked! my kid ate most of it but the pieces I did get were amazing!

other things my fam ordered that I tried:
beef pho - pretty good! meats tasted high quality and the broth was perfect.
shaken beef - super tender and good cut of filet mignon
crepe - my sister had it without shrimp and I know it would be much better with them but it was still good! super crispy!
coffee flan - never had it before but I want it again already! the coffee was nice and strong and the flan was perfect, not to sweet with good texture!

we ended up here by dumb luck (taking the wrong buses multiple times) and I'm couldn't be happier! would definitely come back when we visit SF again!
author: Cindy G.

description: Incredible pho in a fast casual setting! Super fresh and very reasonably priced. We also ordered the rice plate with grilled pork and an imperial roll, which came with a side salad and a sunny side up egg- also super delicious. The staff was polite and prompt. Would definitely recommend for a quick, tasty meal out.
author: Rachel U.

description: Well seasoned food. Tried the Five Spice Shrimp and Chicken broth. Good service and comfortable atmosphere. For sure, I will be back to try something else.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
I'm not sure why this place gets so many YELP stars.  The bun rieu (crab tomato soup) is horrible.  This place is owned by chinese people so it's not really authentic Vietnamese food.

I won't be back.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I'm not big on Pho, so it must be really soulfully good for me to like it.  I liked it.

My wife for garlic noodles and chicken, equally good.  Nice people, great service, comfortable place, good prices.  Like.
author: B R.

description: Decent pho, clean, standoffish staff, but efficient and polite. Nothing special about the food or the pricing. Decent, authentic no frills pho. I would go back.
author: Cody H.

description: Amazing authentic Vietnamese food! I rarely can say that about Vietnamese restaurants because nobody can cook it better than my Mom. The Pho and Bun Rieu noodle soups were both excellent. Just don't forget to ask for the shrimp paste in your Bun Rieu for an extra authentic taste.
author: Linh L.

description: Spring rolls lack creativity but were fresh. Garlic noodo was very good, but this is a Chinese dish. The noodo was not Viet. That's ok. We call that fusion. :-) This girl makes some chewy, thick, egg noodo that is a way better. You have to be more thoughtful with the way you roast the garlic bulb and clarify the butter. But hey,  that's me! My soup, an Americanized Bun Rieu, had a nice, delicate, and balanced broth, but was not authentic. I think they cater to the white hipster residents in the area as there was no ethnic representation other than the servers. I did enjoy my experience because after having our flight delayed 4 hours, we needed some comfy soup. But this is not 4.5 stars though. I guess I'm spoiled because I live in OC near Little Saigon and have access to the best there is for Viet cuisine outside of Vietnam. #blessed
author: Michelle S.

description:
Stopped by before a bike ride across the Golden Gate Bridge.

I got the Vermicelli Bowl with BBQ pork while my boyfriend got the same with chicken, as well as Shrimp Spring Rolls to start.

The Bowls had generous portions of greens which we both appreciated. The meats were grilled nicely as well - the chicken was especially notable. The portions were large and filled us both up.

Solid Viet joint, would stop by again if I'm in the area.
author: Anna M.

description: One of the best places to eat pho. Not only is food delicious and affordable, but the staff is very friendly and attentive with their customers.
author: Yadira C.

description: Loved this place. Right on Lombard, great service, awesome plates and pho! Got the Garlic Noodle shrimp plate and it was good as hell! The shrimp and my Sapporo beer was the perfect combination! Thai ice tea with boba was delicious ! Try the Spring rolls beer, and fried tofu! Service was great, got there at a good time, then outta no where it got pretty full. Good place, if you want some pho and good plates when in the area.
author: J M.

description:
I ordered delivery from Ly's tonight and was very impressed. Here's what I happily stuffed my face with:

-The Five Spice Chicken Pho was very flavorful. The chicken was crispy and was a great addition to the Pho. Plenty of noodles and was super filling. Huge portion as well.

-The Beef Noodles were light and somewhat garlicky. Beef is thin, tender and had a nice grilled flavor.

Side Note: Quick delivery. Estimated time was 45-60 mins, was here in 30. 

Both dishes were outstanding and were great bangs for your bucks. I will be ordering from here next time I'm in the mood for killer noodles and Pho.
author: Rania T.

description: Very average from what I tried so far.  The Bun had too much salad in it and also had pineapples.  Not very authentic.  I think that the Vietnamese around this area are catering to the Marina crowd that doesn't want the real stuff.
author: Mitch A.

description: Was in the neighborhood and freezing last night, so naturally wanted some soup. Ended up here. The veggie pho is YUM. It's filled with actual veggies like mushroom, carrots, and broccoli, with some tofu. Veggie broth is also delicious. Definitely coming back and will skip on the tofu to get some extra veggies instead.
author: Nellie R.

description:
The food is good. I believe that Yelp really is accurate on the recommendations for Viet food. Was brought here when filtering for top rated restaurants and was not disappointed. 

Beef pho, spring rolls, crab paste vermicelli was good
author: Jordan L.

description: I don't understand why this place has good reviews, the pho we has really was not good at all. Totally killed our excitement for pho on a cold day. It had a really bad aftertaste.  Fried tofu was a cool idea in the pho. I really wanted to like this place!
author: Maryam A.

description:
Hailing from the pho wonderland that is Seattle (eg Pho Thân Brothers), I had high expectations coming here.

We ordered the crab paste noodle soup, combo beef pho, and imperial rolls. I was underwhelmed. 
Service was great! Both noodle soups arrived quickly, but not piping hot as expected. Though the noodle and meat portions were ample, the broth for both seem a bit bland and under-flavored, especially the beef pho. I didn't try the imperial rolls, but superficially they didn't seem to hold a candle to Cordon Bleu's on California for consistency and content. 

For pho, I think Turtle Tower still has my heart in SF.
author: Cindy T.

description: Sooooo delicious. Pho is my comfort food and the pho here is so tasty. Tender beef, good quality noodles and balanced broth. Also ordered the cabbage salad, so simple with super fresh ingredients. Hope to come back next time I'm in SF!
author: Katelin R.

description: I discovered this place a few months back while on field assignment and saw it as a place to get some lunch. I enjoyed it very much and love to come back every time I have the opportunity of doing work in the area. I always get their five spice garlic noodle. I also like the service of one of the young lady staff who is always so nice and pleasant.
author: H K.

description:
This little Vietnamese spot is simple in ambiance, but delicious in terms of flavor!

When I say simple I mean: basic white tables, white walls, 1 TV mounted up. In a way, they really let the food here stand out, because the ambiance is not their top priority. You come into this small place with the bare essentials in terms of a restaurant space, but walk out amazed at their food. Do not let the outside of the space or the inside fool you: this place rocks!

The Veggie Pho that I devoured was fabulous! They really have a winning recipe here. Tasty vermicelli, unbelievably flavorful broth (with a slight mushroom taste to it), some tofu and broccoli. All I can say is that this has to be the go-to dish if you're looking to get into Pho and you are vegetarian. The garlic noodles are delightful as well; savory flavor and very satisfying. You really can't go wrong anywhere on their whole menu. Also, the service here is fantastic. You can expect to always have your food on the table in just minutes. Anyways, you get the point right? 

Final verdict: it's not easy finding a good Pho spot in the Marina, but the addition of Ly's to the neighborhood was a great one. It's a perfect place on a rainy day, when it's cold or just when you need a pick-me-up. Whether you're a die-hard Pho addict or just a first timer looking to try Pho, this is your spot!
author: Alex B.

description:
Food: 

The crab noodle soup was to die for, pieces of meat in every bite. The broth was very tasty without being overpowering in any direction. The tomato was a lovely addition to offset that aftertaste of crab. I would have preferred a chewier rice noodle that is usually served in pho, but I honestly can not complain. The noodles were served with the bean sprouts, cabbage, mint, jalapeno slices, and lime wedges. The bean sprouts and the cabbage didnt taste very good so I didnt put any in my soup.

The pandan waffle was very fragrant and was served with coconut ice cream and a thin drizzle of red berry sauce and a mint leaf. The waffle itself was bright green but fragrant with pandan flavor. The coconut ice cream was a little icey but i actually like a little ice crunch in my ice creams. The berry sauce was very sweet and at times a little overpowering. I didn't eat the mint. 

Decor: 

The decor was vert simple, as if the restaurant had just opened. I'm here for the food so this doesnt play a factor in my rating. 

Service: 
They refilled my water when it was close to empty (I've been to many restaurants where this isnt the case unfortunately). I also don't like to be interacted with much when I eat, so if you like that, you will appreciate this place.
author: Glenda L.

description: I'm long overdue for writing this place a review! I eat here at least every other week, and they've never let me down. Cheap, fast, and delicious!
author: Kelsey W.

description: This is hands down the best vietnamese food in the City!!!! They keep the dining area clean and simple. Staff is very friendly and attentive. The what impresses me most is the quality of the food!!! Not to mention the prices that are very affordable. Plenty of street parking. Try this place out when your in the area next time!!!!
author: William H.

description: Ordered take-out for chicken pho the other night and it was so delicious!The broth tasted delicious, nice portion of chicken and added side of steamed veggies. Also the baggie of jalapeno, sprouts and basil was nice and fresh. This will be go-to pho place and I'll be back!
author: Aryn C.

description: I ordered Chicken pho and it did not disappoint. Portions were big too. The service was quick and the people were super friendly.
author: Sourinath C.

description:
Excellent restaurant ! Thefood was amazing ! The service was very good and they were quick and very thoughfull 
I will definetely go back again 
We had Pho and the flavor it was out of this world .....
author: Titincl N.

description: What the Pho? Why is everyone rating this place highly?? My only justification for it is that people eating here aren't familiar with asian food. I ordered pho from here and it was DISGUSTING. Loaded with sugar (YUK) was not served with any herbs or spices - which it REALLY NEEDED. seriously. Don't bother. YUK YUK YUK
author: Julia B.

description: This is by far my favorite place for pho.. that I highly recommend..?the broth is very clean tasting and flavorful.. you can add the condiments as you choose. My favorite is the gulf shrimp pho..the chicken is delicious as well.. all chicken breast slices.. I get it for take out as well as the broth and meat etc keep very well in refrigerator especially if kept separately.. my husband likes the rice and noodle dishes..?
author: Robin H.

description:
Great place for delivery pho!
I was dying on New Years Day, and Ly's Vietnamese Cuisine delivered a piping hot bowl of combo pho to me in 45 minutes. It was delicious, and everything i needed.

Their 5 spice chicken rice plate is pretty good as well.

Pass on the spring rolls - too expensive!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Authentic Vietnamese food by authentic Vietnamese people; not a Chinese imitation or a bastardized distorted fusion of Vietnamese cuisine.

After reading the other reviews that questioned the authenticity of this restaurant, we had to try it out for ourselves.  I'm Vietnamese and verified this venue is "pho real!"

We ordered the pho tai, gio cuon (spring rolls), cha gio (emperor rolls) and string beans with oyster sauce.  The pho was definitely authentic, delicious and came with the traditional condiments of fresh bean sprouts, mint, basil, green chili peppers and hoisin sauce.  The spring rolls were refreshing.  The emperor rolls were delectable and came with real nuoc mam.  By the way the true litmus tests for authenticity are the pho broth and the nuoc mam.  This place passed with flying colors and then some!

Like most authentic VN restaurants, ambiance is secondary to the food so don't expect more than delicious food with great service!

If you're looking for a pho fix, this place is it!  I'm definitely hitting this place after working out at SoulCycle and Equinox.  This is a great addition to the Cow Hollow neighborhood!
author: David N.

description: Ya! This place must be under new ownership, I used to come here when I lived in the hood a few years ago and it used to be a piece of shit with truly the most horrendous service imaginable. It's been redone inside and has a new name so I decided to give it a go based on the newly stellar reviews, it did not disappoint and is a pretty authentic and delicious marina Vietnamese option! I'm moving back and look forward to coming here more. Authentic spring rolls and delicious broth
author: James A.

description:
I lived in Hanoi for a year and had up to four bowls of pho a day, so you could say I'm a bit of a pho-natic. My girlfriend and I stopped in here during a day in SF and both tried the rare beef pho. 

Good pho should be fat free--the broth is made the day before then the day is skimmed off after it has cooled. The pho broth here was quite fatty. My girlfriend and I both saw the grease floating on top when it was served and the aftertaste left a grease residue in my mouth. 

Additionally, and this is being nitpicky, the noodles in the soup were bun, not pho. It was tasty enough but I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're particular about your broth (which, in my opinion, makes or breaks the pho). In terms of service and cleanliness, the place was fine, which is why I gave three rather than two stars.
author: Benjamin R.

description: Wow! This restaurant was wonderful. It's basic, clean, friendly,  and the food was the best Vietnamese I've ever eaten.
author: Elle O.

description:
"That was a good lunch honey." -Wife

"We should've got two of those, because that's not a sharing waffle." -Wife

"I don't know, I think that Pandan Waffle might've bumped this place to a 4.5." -Wife

Four-point-five Stars!
author: James G.

description: I love this place-probably order from them at least once a week.  Literally about to go pick up five spice chicken with garlic noodles as I write this.  Pho is on point as well-can't go wrong.
author: Floyd T.

description: DO NOT ORDER TO GO HERE ordered a 3 meat pho bowl and got one meat ball, two slices of brisket, one tripe this is very insulting take your money somewhere else!!!
author: Raphael C.

description: Very casual environment, consistently amazing pho.  I was surprised by how few good pho places there are in SF, so it was such a blessing to find this place.  I come here nearly every Sunday for lunch and always order the same thing.  Everything tastes amazing, and the service is fast / efficient.
author: Erica F.

description: Ordered takeout, had to wait about 2 minutes when I got there. The service was quick and the staff was pleasant. The food was even better! Got the grilled shrimp with garlic noodles and the wings everything was great.
author: Faith G.

description:
Great food.

We both got the 5 Spice Chicken and Rice plate. We both loved it! Some of the best chicken I've had! The chicken was full of flavor and tender. The rice was perfectly cooked and the egg just topped it off!

We've both heard great things about Bun Rieu which they are renowned for... maybe next time?

The plate was less than $10 each. Great price:)
author: Steven H.

description: I came here wi th my husband and kids. The food was qu ite decent.. I liked the bun rieu, but the pho wasn't that good! Very small for the cos t, found better in Chinatown neighborhood.
author: Lisa F.

description: Again, a bit of a hike unless you live in the Marina, but the shredded chicken pho and the combination beef pho are exceptional. and since it caters to the people in the marina, this place actually looks like it deserves the health score it has posted (unlike a few other places around Civic Center). This is definitely one of those pho places where you do not need to add any thing to the broth (except maybe if you want it spicier, personally, i would just add more fresh jalapenos).
author: Mike V.

description:
Walked in with a terrible cold. Walked out feeling healthy happy :)

Pho ga was amazing the broth soooo good. Loaded it with ginger line and jalapeño to kill my cold 

Viet pancake was refreshing and filling. 

5spice chicken was juicy and crispy. Squeeze a little lime on it and it's magic. 

I don't know who lyn is but thank you for saving my weekend!!!! 

Oh and the staff is super hospitable family style and the atmosphere is calming. 

Eat here now!
author: Armen M.

description: The crab tomato base noodle is fantastic! The soup is clear and tasty, the Vegetables are fresh and clean. The service is good and the price is reasonable. This is the best Vietnamese noodle that I have ever had in SF!
author: Lois G.

description: This place is great!   No frills, good delicious pho.   They should have different size bowl otions though.   We need bigger portions for people that eat a lot!
author: Sara w.

description:
I have never seeked out Pho until yesterday when out SF winter came back for a visit. 

I went in sat down and had the 5 spice chicken pho. It was delicious. The waitstaff was very nice. The place is clean - perhaps not the coziness - but nice.  I am looking forward to trying some more items on the menu.
author: Victoria L.

description: This is one of my favorite takeout places in SF! The ingredients are pretty good and everything I've had on the menu is tasty.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Ly's Vietnamese Cuisine is such a great addition to the Marina. I have an unruly addiction for pho and since there aren't that many good pho places in the Marina (and Asian food in general but that's a story for another time) Ly was my saving grace.

I've had the beef pho, vegetable vermicelli plate, chicken pho, and crab paste noodle soup here so far. If you come here for your first time, I would definitely recommend the chicken pho. I'm usually not a fan of chicken pho because I find it to be less flavorful than beef pho, but Ly's chicken pho is so fragrant and flavorful. In fact, I've literally gone here to get chicken pho three times now in the past week and a half that they recognize me now. The beef pho is delicious as well and if you're looking for something heavier, the crab paste noodle soup hits the spot! My least favorite so far was the vegetable vermicelli bowl. It didn't come with the pineapple, lettuce, bean sprout, daikon, carrot, scallion, peanut, and fish sauce like the menu said. It was just vegetables and vermicelli, which was a letdown. If you're going to eat here, skip everything else and get the pho.

The food here is authentic (in terms of adapting to the Marina crowd the best it could) and delicious. And their service is fantastic. Their service been impeccable every time I've come here, both picking-up and sitting down. The girls are the front are so sweet and always have the best attitude. It's so hard to come across that in the city!
author: Hana K.

description: Wow!!! This place is amazing! Great garlic noodles, and chicken pho.... amazing custumer service! I love this place!
author: Jenn A.

description: San Francisco is cold even in the summer and a bowl of soup does a great job warming up the body.  We were staying close by so Pho was in order and it did not disappoint.  Decent prices and good portions as well as authentic flavors equals a 4 star yelp experience.
author: Monica G.

description: The food is here is quality Vietnamese. The best I've had yet in San Francisco. I speak directly about the Pho because that's what I've had the most, but definitely worth your time. My new go-to spot.
author: Ali J.

description:
Yay finally a legit Vietnamese restaurant in the Marina.  No need to go to overpriced Saiwalks, you can get a fresh hot large bowl of pho for $9-10 bucks. Still more expensive than Chinatown or Tenderloin, but it IS the Marina and rent is probably crazy high.

Very clean and quiet place, it can probably use a little soft background music or decor on the walls. Other than that, very friendly staff and great food for cheap!
author: Angela L.

description:
I called before to see if they have vegan options and the employee who answered was very well prepared, which is surprisingly rare in most restaurants. 

Here's what is vegan:  Veggie pho, fresh spring rolls, veggie rolls, veggie garlic noodle (apparently this comes with a veggie sauce instead of fish sauce but I would double check), veggie rice (ask for no egg). 

I ordered the veggie rolls and veggie garlic noodles. Both were delicious!
author: Katie B.

description: I went to Yelp to find this location.  Family run business.  I was looking at other places serving pho that was close to me.  Looking on their website they were ranked 94 out of 100 from the Health Department.  Other places were between 50 to 70.  We had pho chicken wings and two ice coffee.  I also order garlic noodles with stir fried veggies to go.  Pho was delicious and I loved the broth.  Very clean dining room and warm bathroom(heater)!  Give them a try you won't be disappointed!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: I stumbled across Ly's when looking for some great chicken pho. All of the usual places were closed so I gave Ly's a call. They whipped up some pho for me and it was ready in 15 min and less expensive than any of the other places I've been. Needless to say, it's the best pho I've had yet and now my go to spot!
author: Alexandra T.

description:
I was looking for a PHO place near my work and this is a lovely small restaurant in the Marina. I haven't tried anything but their beef pho. It's not a 5 star high end place, but for what you want it's what you get and I'm very satisfied.

Good tea and nice service.
author: Aaron K.

description: Really really good garlic noodles. The pho and vermicelli noodles was very good too. Environment was clean and waiters was very friendly.
author: Trace B.

description:
They delivered it to my work (Hospital), but, would not come up to the Floor, I literally had to go down & get my food in the main lobby. They don't even deserve a TIP, but, I Did it anyways! Food  is just average, not the best.

IT WAS BETTER WHEN IT USED TO BE "SWEET AROMAS"!!! 

They don't even deserve a 1 Star!!!
author: Michelle Y.

description:
Being from SoCal and living in the heart of Little Saigon I have the best Pho available. Tonight, feeling sick and cold, I needed a taste from home and I found it.  Ly's Pho is as good as any at home. 

I ordered the brisket Pho, Shrimp aspiring Rolls, and Imperial rolls (the spring rolls are for tomorrow). I had it delivered to my apartment which was timely. It was delicious. Everything I was looking for was there in the warm savory broth. I will be a repeat customer and trying out more menu items in the future
author: Diane J.

description: I've sampled pho on a personal mission to find the best on this side of town (without driving to the Richmond/Sunset) -- and Ly's wins. White meat chicken, tasty broth, fresh ingredients. Decent prices, nice staff.
author: Kristin S.

description:
If you want great Vietnamese that is inexpensive and a good clean atmosphere and wonderfully nice staff - that sums up this place!

I typically like to add garlic to my pho and they accommodated my request.
