Additionally, the chicken needs to be thin and shredded to be easy to chew and grab with chopsticks and they have the perfect chicken and texture.

Great job!
author: Mike K.

description:
I'm going to have to bring my review up to 5 stars because their customer service is superb. They read my previous review and brought out cucumber free water!! How awesome is that?! 

We went back to try the vermicelli noodle salad and the angel wings. Again, the price might seem a bit high but the portion is huge. Enough to share between 2 people who aren't starving or for just one famished person. I got the imperial roll and added bbq pork. The bbq pork was so flavorful and juicy. 

My fiancé ordered the angel wings. If you've ever had them at Osha and loved it, you'll love these even more. There's just the right amount of sauce to keep the wings crispy but still add a light (not over powering) sweet and sour flavor. My fiancé was pleasantly surprised at how well these were made. Order the angel wings with a side of rice, these are the best Asian chicken wings in the area (: 

It seems like you just can't go wrong with what you order. Everything is well cooked and not over whelming in taste. Ingredients are fresh and everything is so clean. 

Side note, if you're feeling lazy they deliver!
author: Vivian L.

description:
Craving Vietnamese? This is the spot! They got everything that you can possibly want for any tastebuds. Pho, rice, vermicelli, garlic noodles with an awesome desert menu. We got parking right in front of the restaurant. 

We came here during grand opening from friends' referral. Family owned, service is fast and through. We were treated like family. Portions were perfect. We started off with the Angel wings, portion came with 6 wings, yummy. The shaken beef filet mignon is a must try! Garlic noodle with five spice chicken is awesome. We also had quail, papaya salad, mix vegetables, then shaken beef filet mignon again because it was SOOO good! Amongst all that food, we got grilled beef with rice and that was good also. Finally we finished off dinner with everything on the desert menu, waffle with Icecream, friend banana with Icecream and flan. 

Yes we are pigs. We enjoyed our dinner so much we are definitely coming back!! Thank you. 

The bill was surprisingly reasonable. Ly's Vietnamese cuisine is a must try if you're ever in the area! Feeling lazy? They also deliver!!!! Don't forget to tip your delivery man!
author: Xuan H.

description: The food was great. The chicken pho was really good - some are fairly flavorless but not here. The ambiance is a little sterile, so not the best cozy date spot.
author: Claire G.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Friday evening . We shared Papaya Salad (shredded papaya,white onions, basil, carrots, peanut and house fish sauce) and Imperial Rolls(crisps fried with ground pork, taro, carrots and silver noodles) pretty good! And for entrees, we both ordered veggie pho, very delicious!

 Five stars for the food, 3 stars for service and
5 stars for ambiance. 

We are glad to have Ly's Vietnamese Cruise in the neighborhood!
author: Kelsy L.

description: Had a great meal here.  Got the garlic noodles with five space chicken - noodles were flavorful but not oily (overly buttery), and chicken was well seasoned and juicy with a crispy skin.  Cabbage salad with fried tofu was really light and fresh - more simple in flavor - restaurant if you're reading this, you might want to consider adding some citrus and/or mint to take it up a notch!  Also had the ban xeo (Vietnamese crepe) which was good but I'd probably not order again so I could try other things.  Really excited to come back and try the Pho next time!  Service was great and it's definitely a "nicer" than average Vietnamese place - further indicated by the fact that they accept AMEX and their water has cucumber slices in it
author: Olivia T.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night at around 8 p.m. and I was seated right away! Granted, the place was relatively empty, but it quickly filled up during the course of my meal. The service was excellent. My waitress was very, very nice and only added to the overall lovely experience I had. Seeing I was seated next to the speakers, she checked if I was okay with the music volume (absolutely I was, once I heard "This I Promise You") and refilled my water (lemon water, which was quite refreshing). 

I ordered the Fresh Spring Rolls (shrimp) for an appetizer, the Beef Pho (3 type combination because I'm indecisive), and a Thai Iced Tea for a drink. They weren't kidding when they said Fresh Spring Rolls. I took a bite and, honestly, it was one of the best spring rolls I've had in a long time. The peanut sauce that it came with really burst with flavor, as well. Then the Beef Pho portion was *huge* to the point that I literally took a Snapchat of it and went "They expect me to eat all of this?!" And by some miracle, I did, or at least most of it. I added Sriracha and some hoisin sauce, as per my usual take on pho, but the meats and noodles were perfectly cooked, while the broth was perfect. Couldn't finish off the broth (seriously, the bowl was the size of my head) but having the Thai Iced Tea at the end was great - wonderfully made, as well.

Definitely would come back here again!
author: Alessandra E.

description:
love this place! it's our Sunday night ritual :) & we've turned on many of our friends to this place as well. 

excellent chicken pho - it's the only kind we get. they are nice size portions, they use skinny noodles, provide all the fix-ins, the broth isn't salty & their chicken is white meat and not rubbery. 

spring rolls no mint - fresh & delish ! 

Love the fact that they deliver within a close radius since we're in North Beach
author: danielle a.

description:
I am a real foodie and I can say that this is truly excellent SF Vietnamese food!    This is real home cooking.  The pho broth is the best in the City! 
I highly recommend!!!!
author: Cathy B.

description: I had the crab paste pho. Very good but a little on the salty side. My bf also liked the chicken pho very much.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Service/ Ambience: 
-Very pleasant service. This place is very clean and simply decorated. They do deliver but only within a certain radius. I did see a lot of take out orders being placed as well.

Food:
-Egg Rolls were good, but they do come in small portions. For size comparison think of three normal egg rolls cut into halves for around 10$. Like I said, they were good, but not good enough to be paying a hefty price for.

-The pho was extremely flavorful. I have to admit the egg rolls disappointed me but boy, was I blown away by their pho. First off their meat and noodle portions are great, but the broth is where they exceeded my expectation. The broth was very flavorful and you could tell there were a lot of ingredients involved that brought he flavor to life. I have been to many pho places and this place has definitely moved into my top three.

TLDR: The pho is good, egg rolls are provided in small portions, and the service is pretty good. A very solid viet food joint.
author: Edward C.

description: I order for pick up often and their bun rieu, which I highly recommend, is always satisfying! Their garlic noodles are pretty flavorful as well.
author: Sui N.

description: The pork rice plate is great. The meat was well marinate and moist even after the grilling.
author: Alvin S.

description: Only one size of Pho available,  which I'm not used to. Got rhetoric vegetable pho sith beef broth and I love all the extra veggies they add, that other restaurants don't use.  Service was fast and very friendly! Definitely Wil be back anytime we want some delicious pho and maybe try other menu items.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Went there with my family, and we all got the vermicelli noodle salad with pork and shrimp... it tasted good but it was just little sweeter than expected....and the portion was decent.
author: Subodhani M.

description: I would say average Vietnamese food at best. Portions is very stingy and taste is not as authentic. 3 stars is for the hard working people and not so much the food. I'll still eat here every once in a long while for convenience and if I don't feel like cooking but that's about all I can say...
author: Eddie N.

description: Arrived in San Francisco on a flight that was three hours late. It was 8:20 and we were starving in an unfamiliar San Francisco neighborhood. Luckily, Yelp came to the rescue once again. Within thirty minutes we had a delicious Vietnamese dinner delivered to our hotel room. Everything tasted fresh and perfectly cooked. We ate pot stickers, papaya salad with shrimp (less spicy than we are accustomed to, but delicious), broccoli with oyster sauce, and grilled pork with garlic noodles. Our nine-year-old devoured the noodles and pot stickers. Very reasonable prices. Wish that Bellingham had this kind of delivery option.
author: Danielle M.

description: Great spot for pho on a cold winter day. Table ordered vegetable, chicken, and beef pho with imperial rolls as a starter. Definitely recommend.
author: Aaron C.

description: Great food and staff. I would come back and recommend it to my friends. This place is ideally situated on the way to the Golden Gate Bridge (or back) by bus. Sit yourself.
author: Matthew C.

description: Awesome cheap Vietnamese place where you can get a huge bowl of good pho for about $9-$10. I decided to be adventurous and tried the crab paste pho, and it was fantastic! A lot of pho places don't give you a ton of meat and you end up paying extra, but here they give you a lot of it. Great, quick service as well.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
SUMMARY: I would definitely eat here again, or order from here for delivery or pickup!  The food was tasty and well prepared, and the service and wait staff were friendly and helpful.  5 stars for the friendly wait staff and attention to service, and 4 stars for the food!  Plus, it's reasonably priced and affordable.

Full review:
Four of us came here last night for our monthly get dinner themed "around the world" and the letter for this month was V. It was my turn to chose the cuisine and restaurant, so I chose Vietnamese.  Since the local Vietnamese spots serving Dungeness crab are unable to serve crab currently because of the meat's high toxicity, I had to look for other options (I had originally made reservations at PPQ Dungeness). So I chose this spot, Ly's, since it got good reviews and was easy to access for everyone.

Ly's was a really good decision, and we all enjoyed it.

Walking in, it was clear that it's a clean space. A member of the wait staff who welcomed us was very friendly and accommodating and sat us down for a 7pm reservation. I ordered the crab paste noodle soup, and it was delicious. I never had this super for,  and I was looking for something different and authentic, something that I never had before. I asked for fresh tofu instead of the typical fried tofu that comes with the dish, and the server was happy to make that change for me. I also got it with the extra meatball, even though the waitress had recommended getting it with chicken. But I had a lot of chicken yesterday, so a meatball was a nice change of pace. Next time I would definitely consider getting it with chicken - not of the meatball wasn't good, but because the friendly waitress said that was the best / most popular preparation.

We also ordered the spring rolls with pork, which were large and flavorful. Two of my friends the ordered garlic noodles with the filet mignon and with the five spice chicken, and I would definitely consider ordering those in the future. The beef was really tender and tasty, as was the chicken. The fourth member in our party ordered the shrimp, and it was okay.  The steamed broccoli that came with the garlic noodles was good, too.

We also had the sauteed string beans, which were bit salty but the flavor and texture were good.
author: Andrew D.

description:
A small place with big flavor!
Excellent five spice chicken vermicelli and the best pho we've had in a very long time.
Next time we'll try the garlic noodles, papaya salad, and crepe.  We'll be back for more...
author: David B.

description:
I have searched for a good Pho place in the Marina, and have found the spot. Friendly service, tasty food, and reasonable prices. 

I usually have the rare beef pho & five spice chicken with garlic noodles. Always leave satisfied.
author: Vera B.

description: Wow!!! I ordered online and my order was delivered within 25 mins!! Reasonable prices, great taste and fast delivery. We ordered shrimp fresh spring rolls, cabbage salad,  grilled beef vermicelli and garlic noodles with 5 spice chicken and all were great! Knocked off a star because I didn't like the thick noodles served with the chicken and the peanut sauce that accompanies the rolls was too runny, but of course it depends on your preference. I highly rec this restaurant!! You will not be dissapointed.
author: Noor S.

description: The rice is too dry. Pho is at average, good beef but under average rice noodles. I thought we got a rice noodles ball before taking them apart to make them real noodles. The five favor chicken is great, but the skin is over cooked.
author: Yuan X.

description: Food is delicious (especially chicken or pork with garlic noodles), staff are friendly and takeout is ALWAYS ready super quickly and early!!! Highly recommend
author: Jan T.

description:
[Update: Still my favorite!]

Excellent Pho. Great family run restaurant. 

Has become my go-to Vietnamese spot (sorry Larkin street!)
author: Noah B.

description:
The garlic noodles with tofu is amazing!!!! Can't get enough of them!!!!

And I love the staff! So friendly!!!
author: Traci S.

description:
We got the pho combo and the grilled pork on rice and both were very delicious. The pho came with a good amount of noodles and yummy broth. The grilled pork was tender and was as good as it gets! The spring rolls are a different style as compared to viet spring rolls from NYC. The skin is thinner and crunchier than what we are used to but the flavor is just as great! 

We got the pandan waffles with ice cream to go and they were nice enough to pack it separately for us. Even though the flavors were still great, I would recommend eating this item in house. The waffle would be freshly toasted and the ice cream still frozen. We regret taking this item to go because we can only imagine how much more delicious it could have been.

The service was super friendly and personable. The cucumber infused water was a nice touch. I would go there again and again.
author: Jen L.

description:
Best Pho in the city, hands down, full stop.  

Reasonably priced (by SF standards) with delivery it is a great choice for those cold foggy summer nights.
author: John C.

description: Food was fresh and delicious. The waitresses were swamped but managed to provide good service, and prices were low. The site is in a shadier part of the Marina district, if there is such a thing, but it's worth seeking it out. I'm not sure what to think about TVs on the wall. Distracting but great if you don't want to pay attention to your dining partners. They do a brisk business in both in-house dining and take-out, so that may explain why all the ingredients were super fresh. Overall, I couldn't say anything bad about the food. Decor? At these prices and quality, the decor is a-ok!
author: Ichor B.

description: My go-to spot for pho! I love their chicken pho and my boyfriend loves the satay pho. Always delicious, fast and fresh. The service here is fantastic as well!
author: Natalie T.

description: Ly's Vietnamese is absolutely delicious!!! Having travelled around Vietnam I can be a pretty harsh critic of Pho but Ly's is absolutely up there! I love the five spice chicken, the broth is always super tasty and never oily- try the shrimp rolls they're delicious too!
author: Allie S.

description: We visited San Fransisco and while we stayed at the Fairmont I went to this place 3 times in the 5 days we were there; yes it is THAT GOOD. The 5 spice chicken was AMAZING. The pho was equally good, spicy and rich which was just right after a day out on the bay. Ask for extra veggies and they hook it up! When we go back to San Fransisco this is the first place my wife and I would stop.
author: Emanuel C.

description: Beef pho was extremely tasty and filling. Flavors weren't "fake" tasting like so many places seem to be.
author: Tim J.

description:
Bun Rieu was decent. I don't really know what the overdramatic nature of some of the reviewers on this restaurant is coming from, but I think it was not totally lifechanging on my part of the experience.

Do not order Iced Vietnamese Coffee. They premake it and bring it out on this sundae cup filled with chipped ice with a narrow straw ... I actually was compelled to ask why the coffee doesnt come with strainers for me to see it being brewed (like so many restaurants in the city have it) and she said they make it for you cause they dont want customers to wait ... I dont know what kind of impatient children they had to serve before going through this route of butchering the coffee, but I had to send back after the taste of the coffee resembled a starbucks frapuccino that was half blended.

Service however was good. A friendly staff team overall. Would give it another try one day minus coffee.
author: Al L.

description: So glad we've found this place! I had the garlic noodles with shrimp and it was fresh and delicious! Service was quick and the the restaurant was spacious with a nice relaxed atmosphere. Will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Hannah D.

description: Ly's has nice, simple decor and fast friendly service. It's simple and the prices are right. At least for Pho--which I came here to grab--it's merely adequate. Meat was a bit skimpy and noodles weren't cooked perfectly. I'd go if I were back in the area but it's far from the best Pho that I've had or even really good Pho. You can do better. Go, but don't seek it out.
author: Eli L.

description: Went here thinking it would be decent but found their sauces and BBQ pork seasoning excessively sweet. Only one pho noodle option also didn't help experience.
author: Oscar F.

description:
Ordered spring rolls and got summer rolls. Super slow service. Why does pho take 20 mins?

Pho broth was very dark and not flavorful. Honestly seemed like it's not even pho. More like Chinese herbal soup. Just definitely not right. 

Cold vermicelli with pork is not bad.
author: Christina And Terence T.

description:
***I STRONGLY RECOMMEND THIS FOR VEGETARIANS (and just health conscious people in general)!***

I've only gotten delivery here via Eat so I can't comment on the service or atmosphere of the restaurant. All I can say is that for people who claim their dishes are flavorless, you obviously have been abusing your taste buds. That is a shortcut a lot of restaurants take - overdosing on sugar, salt, and spice so most likely, your taste buds have lost sensitivity.

The VEGETABLE PHO broth is insanely rich with a strong, smooth mushroom flavor and not your typical MSG-broth of cancer you get at a lot of asian restaurants. Did I just say a vegetable broth is RICH? Yes, arguably richer than the beef pho broth. Pho is really one of those hearty dishes for when you're sick or need to balance your diet. I had a fever and ate this to get my body going again and it did the job. 

I've also tried the BEEF PHO which was also really tasty and non-fatty/oily. Again, very flavorful and hearty - I didn't even need to throw in sriracha or hoisin sauce. I would order this regularly as it's such a great execution of a classic, if I lived nearby (or even in the same city ha). 

VIETNAMESE COFFEE: pretty standard, but not from mix. 

All in all, I think this is a no-shortcut Vietnamese restaurant with solid food and healthy options (just avoid the fried foods which is common sense.)
author: Ulla L.

description:
Stopped in today for some pho before work for lunch.  Excellent spicy beef pho.  Full of spice and flavor.  Some of the best I've tried in a while.   I will definitely be ordering for delivery when I'm feening some pho at work.  Great job guys keep it up.   

Very nice organized clean establishment.
author: Nick D.

description: This is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants that I have ever experienced. Coming from Los Angeles, I have had my fair share of pho and Vietnamese food. Ly's tops them all. The restaurant was incredibly clean and open. The pho and spring rolls were AMAZING!! Everything was so fresh, I swear they make their noodles in house! The chicken and beef broth have incredible flavor. Ly's has a casual yet trendy atmosphere that embodies the spirit of San Francisco. Great job!!!
author: Megan A.

description:
After seeing the fantastic reviews we finally ordered delivery. The food was fantastic, the chicken pho had so much flavor, the grilled beef was thin and slightly sweet. The garlic noodles were flavorful and not too greasy. 
Our order arrived in about 20 minutes and was neatly packaged which isn't always the case with delivery. 
This will definately be our go to for Vietnamese food. Prices are extremely reasonable for the neighborhood and a bonus there is no delivery fee. A must check out if your in the neighborhood.
author: Tim L.

description:
One of the best pho and vermicelli bowls I've had - and I have had MANY. Absolutely amazing customer service too! Definitely recommend and will be back.

Went back a week later and tried their new sauté pho (spicy broth) and it was the best decision I've ever made. I haven't been able to stop thinking about it. NEW FAVORITE PLACE.
author: Audrey I.

description:
we went there because of high star reviews but the food taste ordinary.

location: parking is a challenge like most of the establishment. there is a side street parking option although we walked going here as it is just 3 blocks away from the hotel.

food: ordered beef pho, spring roll, and thai iced tea.  beef pho is good. i liked the peanut sauce for spring roll and their thai iced tea tasted absolutely good (although half of the glass is ice).

price is very affordable and servers are friendly, accommodating and attentive.
author: Abby P.

description: This is the best restaurant in the world. My boyfriend and I come here once a week and the pho is just marvelous.  Super nice and fast :) love lys
author: Hannah G.

description: Yum yum. Good service. Great pho.  Have tried a number of things on their menu and liked them all.
author: Griffin C.

description: Best pho I've ever had!!! I got the grilled tiger shrimp pho! Man oh man!! Come here peeps!! Made me feel happy inside!!! Nice hole in the wall and delicious!
author: Maira B.

description:
They closed at 9 pm the day we went and we found out why. They don't need to stay open late, everybody, EVERYBODY orders delivery, so they do ok.

Had the rare beef and beef ball pho, noodles were the thin chewy ones, really good, the soup stock was super hot which is a warm welcome compared to other pho places but the beef portions were tiny :( Also the smallest wedge of lime I've ever seen, unless they were cutting key limes, and not enough bean sprouts.

Friend had the 5 spice chicken vermicelli, she inhaled it and said it was amazing. The fresh shrimp rolls were actually fresh and yums.

The staff is Cantonese speaking and they were really considerate in English and Chinese. The delivery guy was working miracles from what we saw and the water had cucumber in it which was a nice touch. 

Go for the hot ass broth, very good on a rainy day, but maybe get vermicelli too, looked way more filling. Go forth and eat!
author: Mira T.

description: Great pho, even for n00bs like myself. We got the rare beef pho, for takeout. Don't be surprised by how rare (read: completely raw) the beef is- noodles and beef come in one container, pho broth in another, and the bean sprouts and jalapeños and basil leaves in another package. If you order takeout, its up to you to combine the meat with the hot broth. Quick service, good food!
author: J T.

description: Amazing pho! My sister and I went a couple weeks ago when we were both feeling under the weather and their soup was amazing. I will definitely be returning. They had speedy service!
author: Krista M.

description:
Pretty standard Pho joint.  The main draw is that it's close to the office so I can drop in whenever I want or order in for lunch/dinner at work.

Service is what you'd expect.  Not exceptional but not bad.  Food-wise, the imperial rolls are a little small but the taste is fine and the spring rolls are pretty much what they're supposed to be.

Now on to the Pho.

I generally get the Beef Combo which includes rare steak, brisket, and meatballs.  Noticeably absent is flank which I found weird but it's not a deal breaker.  The noodles are fine from all the times I've been there so nothing in particular to worry about.  The broth is where things are slightly different.  It's just a tinge off from the reference Pho flavor.  Not enough to turn me away, but it's certainly not what I know and love.

All in all, Ly's will get the job done for a Pho craving if you don't want to go to Sunset but it's certainly not going to knock your socks off.
author: Chris C.

description:
Alright how does this place have 4 and half stars??
Maybe it's because I'm a vegetarian.

First off, atmosphere of this place is cold and uninviting, we were the only people in there and there was a woman who worked there Facetiming behind us -- but on to the actually important stuff.  The food.

I got the vegetable pho and the bf got the vermicelli . There was an above average flavor to the vegetable pho, mushroom like, which was nice but still not worth 5 stars!!

But hey eat here if you want too.
author: Dede C.

description:
Mediocre at best. If I had to guess, given the presentation and preparation this is run by Chinese not Vietnamese. Very mediocre pho and the rice dishes were more like Chinese dishes than any Vietnamese I've ever had. 

As some background, I have been eating Vietnamese for over 15 years probably at least once every two weeks. I have first generation Vietnamese as friends and even dated one for some time. My home town has a large population of Vietnamese and many many pho places. This would fall below average there. 

Don't get me wrong. It wasn't bad food and the meat in the filet rice dish was tender. Prices are fair. But not remarkable or special.
author: Josef K.

description: Reasonable prices. They made spring rolls better than any other Vietnamese restaurants I've ate in San Diego
author: 佳文

description: Okay food. Got it ordered to my house. Had spring rolls and beef pho. The amount of noodles to soup ratio was ridiculous. It was barely 1/4 of the take out box. I called in and the people were nice and sent me more noodles since I was just 10 minutes away. That's why I gave it 2 stars. On the other hand, the spring roll had hair in it... We didn't even bother eating those.
author: Brandon C.

description:
Small place as it's in San Francisco.

I got the combo pho.

Best meatballs I've ever had.

Pretty damn good.

Very nice service, accommodated my requests.

I was only visiting so I probably won't be back but I definitely recommend if you're in the area.
author: Imma P.

description:
My husband and I were walking down Clement St. one night and we saw a little Vietnamese take-out banh mi shop.  The priciest item on there was $4, and I pointed this out to my husband and said, "You see this?  NEVER pay more than this for a Vietnamese sandwich."

Of course I'm referring to made-for-the-inexperienced-or-unadventurous-American-palate (if your idea of Japanese food is chicken teriyaki and California rolls, and your idea of Chinese food is orange chicken, you fall into this category) places like Bun Mee and Saiwalks.  Both are more than double the price of what banh mis should cost, nor are they even remotely as good.  You could take an Uber to the TL and back to buy a banh mi, and it would still come out to be cheaper than a meal at either Bun Mee or Saiwalks!

When Ly's opened, we were like, okay let's hope to god this place is better than Saiwalks.  The Marina has sorry representatives of Asian food, and we were excited to see what looked more like a hole-in-the-wall than a posh hip Chestnut street restaurant.

Let's compare prices to Saiwalks:

Pho:
Saiwalks - $12.  Ly's - $9.

Rolls (imperial, spring):
Saiwalks - $9.  Ly's - $6.

Rice and/or vermicelli bowls/plates:
Saiwalks - $13-14.  Ly's - $9-10 (unless you get the filet mignon, which is $13).

I liked my chicken pho better than my husband's beef pho, but I also don't eat much beef so there's that.  Enjoyed the spring rolls, but wasn't a huge fan of the imperial rolls - the flavor was good, but the ground pork inside was too much.  Ly's also has garlic noodle plates, and though the garlic taste wasn't super heavy, it was good, and I packed mine away for lunch the next day.

Size-wise, Ly's is a much heftier portion.  Their food is also WAY tastier and much more authentic than Saiwalks (which, IMHO, is a gigantic ripoff and not authentic.  It's like saying Taco Bell is real Mexican food).

Seriously super happy this place opened!  There's FINALLY a good place to get a piping hot bowl of noodle soup on a cold foggy night, and there's FINALLY some AUTHENTIC Vietnamese food in the neighborhood!  Now if only a good Chinese place would open up...
author: Tori S.

description:
Decent pho, definitely not great but it will hit the spot if your craving noodle soup in the area. It's run and owned by Vietnamese people so that's a plus. The pho, however, was lacking in depth and flavor, and also had a strong taste of something I couldn't pin down. Egg rolls were meh...pathetic actually; $7 for 3 rolls cut in half. Didn't serve it with the lettuce/mint/cucumber mix like most Vietnamese restaurants do. Garlic noodles with pork was the best dish. The noodles were on the drier side but still had flavor and I found myself eating more of this.  Service was spot on. 

Overall I wouldn't come back here again, especially not paying $11.75 for a combo pho. But hey, it's in the marina..what do you expect.
author: Joy T.

description: This is hands down the best pho I've had in a long time. The service was fast and friendly and the location was easy to find. Would def come back next time I'm in the area.
author: Alessandra Z.

description: Had the vermacelli salad with pork. It was just as expected. Great taste but with salad leaves taking up much of the space I left feeling a little hungry. Service was prompt and atmosphere was fairly quiet.
author: David S.

description:
Good service and food.
Ordered chicken pho and greatly enjoyed it.
Prices are reasonable.
If you are vegetarian, you can still enjoy the meal.
Relatively chill place where you could plausibly bring books or laptop, but loudish around dinner.
The restroom is nice but there is only one for which you might have to wait in line.
For some reason, restaurant is not open on Tuesday.
author: Chandana G.

description: A must place to go specially in the winter; the warm broth just revives you. I personally am a big fan of pho, I'll have to have it every week. But my recommendation for this place would be the crab meat soup- it is a little spicy, but you could do with some heat in the winter. If you aren't at all into spices though, try their regular pho, it's good too. I know this place is going to turn into my Sunday brunch comfort food during winter!
author: Fatema M.

description: Best vietnamese in SF I've had! I had peanut satay pho, spring rolls, and iced coffee, it was amazinggg!
author: Elia A.

description: Their garlic noodles are delicious. Perfectly cooked and not greasy. The imperial rolls are also tasty. Our waitress was very nice.
author: Darius A.

description: Fast delivery and the grilled beef and garlic noodles were delicious! Highly recommend.
author: Leslie G.

description: The garlic noodles and pork were delicious, perfectly cooked, the right amount of flavor. The Pho Brisket was very filling and flavorful. Great price too. It was also nice that they provided forks for those of us who don't want to use chopsticks
author: Brice M.

description: The five spice chicken rice was tasty, crispy in the outside and juicy in the inside. Affordable and clean environment.
author: Ryan M.

description:
5 Stars for Ly's chicken Pho.  It is be the best I have had in a long time.  Chicken was nice shredded white meat.  Non of the fatty pieces left over pieces of chicken that many other places use.  Broth is awesome.
The chicken was so good, but there wasn't much.

I got the Fresh Spring rolls with Tofu.  They are very plain, but the ingredients are very fresh!  I would probably order them again, but maybe ask if they could add another ingredient?  Mango, if they have it?  They come a little warm.  There is a lot of lettuce and a little sprouts.  The dipping sauce is good, but I would probably ask for a peanut sauce.
author: Brooke H.

description: The shredded chicken pho is great.  I didn't put any sauce in it.  The Broth was excellent as is.  Service is also fast.  This place is a hidden gem.  Best pho I've had in the city.
author: Leanne C.

description: Food is great! I had the spring roll and rare beef pho. The shrimps in the spring rolls were really fresh and the pho's soup was really tasty. No sign of msg, but not 100% sure. For the quality of food I got, I don't think it's expensive.
author: Sunny L.

description: I'm probably being mean giving it only 3 stars but it's ok and I wouldn't say I was a particular fan.  I did like the place and thought it was good value for a cheap place with no atmosphere.  The food tasted pretty good.
author: Norman B.

description: I found this place tonight while driving in the city. Something about this place appealed to me from the outside and I decided to take a chance. I ordered the grilled beef with egg and steamed rice, along with a side of the house garlic noodles. I am a very picky eater and if the food isn't on point. I would be the first to let it be known. I really liked the presentatation of the food and I must say that I was quite impressed with the flavors that were in the dishes . I would definitely drive from the east bay on purpose to come here.
author: LaMar T.

description: Such a great hidden gem on Lombard. Super clean and authentic Vietnamese cooking. My favorite is the beef satay pho!
author: Alejandro S.

description: Pho is very good. Broth is oily and has great depth. Some of the better pho I've had. If I am nearby, this will be my go-to place for pho, but I wouldn't travel across town for it. Service was friendly. The shaken filet mignon was just ok, tasted a little burned on the outside.
author: James N.

description: Outstanding! We had beef Pho, fresh rolls, garlic noodles, five spice chicken and pork vermacilli salad and every dish was terrific. The flavors so distinct but subtle. No one thing overwhelming the overall tastes of the dishes. Bright clean restaurant with efficient, friendly staff.
author: Sally S.

description:
Review for takeout only.  Food is great, especially for the prices!  Much less expensive and tastier than Saiwalks over on Chestnut.  So happy there is a good Vietnamese restaurant in the area.

I've tried the rare beef pho and vermicelli noodle with pork so far and have been really happy with both.  My husband really liked his fresh veggie spring rolls too.

I hope this place stays around!  I just wish they would add vietnamese sandwiches to the menu...
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Best Pho I've had in SF. There was a place I loved in Los Angeles for years. This pho beats that one just barely. The flavor, amount, and quality seem perfect. This will be my go to pho spot for years to come I hope. 

Thai tea was good. Imperial rolls were good enough, but more like 3-4 star. Their interior is alright but they are super friendly and nice. And god damn this pho is awesome!
author: Parker K.

description: Really tasty 5 Spice Vermicelli Salad at a great price point!!! Also the new N/A beverage menu was a nice surprise! I had the berry tea..yum!!!
author: Michelle B.

description: I really enjoyed my experience at this new Vietnamese restaurant. Food are great, price is affordable and great service. The papaya salad was the highlight of my meal because it's so light and refreshing. My dad who ordered the chicken with garlic noodle is also great. He said the chicken was grilled perfectly that was crispy and moist at the same time. My mom ordered tomato base noodle. The broth is very tasty. The only dish that was so so was the stir fry vegetable. It was ok but compare to other outstanding dishes. Since this place is new, the seating area is very welcoming and bright. I hope they keep up the quality and I shall visit again.
author: Ling L.

description: Had dinner twice here! Just down the road from the marina inn where we were staying. Loved it. Simple decor... good service... excellent food.... good price I think the locals use it regularly as there were many pick ups of food heading out the door.
author: Rich B.

description: Great iced coffee and the Beef Satay Pho was very spicy and very tasty (also very filling).
author: Daniel J.

description: It was a nice place to come, the food was fresh and good quality, the service was fine, lots of choices for customers to choose, great place for non-Asian who want to eat Asian food. Not recommended for Asian
author: Uyen L.

description:
We dropped by Ly's to grab some take-out for a picnic and were very impressed. Customer service was excellent - you can tell that the place is run with a lot of love. As soon as we walked in, the staff was incredibly friendly and went the extra mile to welcome us. As we waited for our food, they brought out free cucumber water! We also received a discount that they're offering because of their recent opening. 

Onto the food. We had the house special garlic noodles, which are stir-fried in garlic butter, with fish sauce, scallions and steamed broccoli, with a side of seasoned veggies, including a generous helping of perfectly done, incredibly tender shitake mushrooms. Loved this! We also had the shredded papaya salad. All the ingredients were super fresh and the tofu was a nicely crisped. 

Ambience - clean and simple. 

We'll definitely be stopping by again!
author: Leah M.

description: Solid bowl of pho. Huge portions. Quick delivery. 5 spice chicken and garlic noodles is addictive!
author: J W.

description: Great Bun Riu , clean atmosphere and great location! Would def come back here. A little slow but worth it! Recommended to all!
author: Nate E.

description:
Walking around this area and found this place. Had the garlic noodles and five flavor chicken. 
Noodle is very good, buttery and garlicky. 
Chicken is crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.

So good I forgot to take a picture! :(

If you live around this area, should definitely check this spot out.
author: Anh V.

description: Could not have been happier with this place!    Started with cucumber and lime flavored water, nice touch.  I got the papaya salad with tofu.  Great flavors with very well cooked and crunchy tofu.  Also tried garlic noodles with beef; very tasty; and then the beef pho.  Tasty broth good amount of beef and vegetables as well.  Staff was super friendly also and the place was very clean and to top it all off it was well priced.  Then got the Vietnamese flan...never even heard of it, but glad we got it!  Similar to a Mexican flan, but this was smoother and the sauce was sweet, but also had a clear kick of coffee to it as well.  Wish they had banh mi sandwiches too, but what they had was great.
author: W. Dane N.

description: none of the food was very good today,the garlic noodles were especially dry and tasteless. Oh well!
author: Nan P.

description: The five spice chicken vermicelli noodles are a huge let down. The chicken was grey and very rubbery/fatty. I took one bite and spit it out. I did order the vegetable pho and that was good. Recommendation would be to stick to the vegetarian dishes.
author: Cari S.

description: Pho and shrimp papaya salad are two of my favorite entrees here.  I love love love the coffee flan..brings me back to my travels to Vietnam.  A must try if you're in the area.
author: Belle P.

description: Wish I could have tried there food but after waiting 15min for them to open I couldn't wait anymore.
author: Alex L.

description: This is my go-to spot.  The Chicken Pho is AWESOME.  Nothing cures the Sunday spooks or a hangover like a huge bowl of it.  I've also had the rolls and the green beans which were also delicious.  It's a reasonably priced place in the marina, which is unheard of, so that's nice!   And they're quick, clean, and friendly.  I get take out all the time and they never forget any pieces of the order.  Check it out and enjoy!!
author: Brittany R.

description: This place has some of my favorite pho I've ever had. The shrimp are cooked to perfection and the broth is so yummy. Perfect meal on a cold rainy day!
author: Kitton E.

description:
What can one say about Vietnamese food. 
We ordered bun and flan cake. They made the salad in the bun a little differently than other places which we love, plus the bun itself was warm which is great. Other places just give you cold bun which is ridiculous. The flan cake was well made. Service was awesome. 
We have already thinking of eating here again before leaving  San Francisco.
author: ZeZe G.

description: Went based on Yelp reviews. Soup was really good, very tasty broth. I ordered the vegetarian pho. It didn't come with many veggies, needed more, some mushrooms would have been nice too. Still good. Decor is drab, very white, not terribly relaxing but whatever. Overall worth a visit for the pho.
author: M K.

description:
Super sweet servers/ owners. Answered all our sauce/ ingredient related questions very patiently and it was reassuring that they clarified since we're strict vegetarians. Helped cancel an order when we realized the portion of our first dish was too big. 
The food wasn't at all oily which is AWESOME. It was however not too flavorful as the tofu strips were very meagre, and the only other flavor was cabbage. Could have appreciated more vegetables and tofu in short. This was a bowl of noodles and veggie order.
author: Nutcrackin C.

description:
Randomly came across this place while hungry and walking on Lombard.  My husband and I went in and instantly became fans.  You can tell it's newer as it wasn't super busy but the food was great!  The hubby had pho with beef and loved it...I had the rice with five spice chicken and loved it.  So I had never experienced this kind of set-up with rice, egg, (delicious) chicken...so good.  

They mentioned if you want the whole dungeness crab, just let them know ahead of time and they will make sure to bring it in for you...which is super helpful for a local like myself who grabbed the delivery menu.

Price point is good, food is great, will definitely go again.  It's a great little find in the area!
author: Tracy S.

description:
Wow! The garlic noodles were amazing! The 5 spice chicken was perfectly cooked with so much flavor and a nice crisp on the outside. I also had the shrimp spring rolls which were delicious. 

The restaurant leaves a bit to be desired in its atmosphere which is pretty stale but the food is so good and reasonably priced I will be back again. 

Also love their cucumber and lemon infused water!
author: John T.

description: Ph  is so good.and spice noodles chickens is awesome.i come to this place 5 day a week.
author: Kelvin P.

description:
Food was good, service fast. 
I would say that the portions were rather small, but good quality. Simple and tasty.
author: Cristina v.

description: I would give this place three thumbs up if I had a third. This has become my go to stop if you want a good quick and rather cheap meal in the marina. The garlic noodles and shaking beef are usually my choices while my girlfriend usually gets the cabbage salad. Also the vegetable pho is really good and they give you plenty of veggies to make sure you aren't just having broth. They deliver and are open pretty late, staff is always friendly and nice so thats always a plus as well. Finally i'm not stuck driving all over town for some good pho!
author: Dmitriy G.

description: It's a good Vietnamese place. Small, clean, good food, friendly service and ok value. Not really that distinct from other VN restaurants in the Bay Area, but given its location I don't think there are that many others nearby.
author: Philip S.

description:
I have only had take out but it has all been very good.  

I tried the shakin beef noodle bowl, chicken pho, braised green beans and papaya salad.    The meat is cooked perfectly so it is tender and flavorful.  The veggies are fresh and not over cooked.  Even the chicken pho, which I usually find bland without a bottle of Siracha, was very flavorful and fresh tasting.  Also you get a glass of cucumber water as you wait which I always enjoy.  

The update of the inside looks nice too.  Feels very clean.
author: Courtney C.

description:
I been eaten a lot of pho in my lifetime and this is one of the best pho I ever has , I give 5 stars for it and I believe they have some other good food here ( cause I just love pho ;)
Nice and clean restaurant
Friendly and good service
author: Minh N.

description:
Steaming bowl of Pho,
Breaks the chill of cold Fall night. 
Sunday passes on.
author: Haiku Reviews ..

description: We stopped by here last night on our way to a comedy show at Fort Mason. It was quite tasty! I typically expect to pay a bit less for Vietnamese food, but I suppose a price hike is to be expected in the Marina area. I got garlic noodles with pork and an imperial roll. My wife got the same but with vermicelli noodles (bun). The pork was flavorful and delicious. The garlic noodles were a nice texture but could've used a little more flavor. Both dishes were a good portion size with plenty of meat. I'd come back if I was in the area and hankering for Vietnamese food!
author: Laura B.

description: Good Bun Rieu and fast service! The only place in SF that delivers yummy pho. It is a bit pricier because of the location but there is no where else in the Marina that can serve this and at that price.
author: annie w.

description: Our last night in SF, the wife wanted something normal, not greasy or heavy so we searched Yelp and found Ly's which was a few blocks from where we were staying. I got the rice and pork dish, the wife got the chicken pho dish. Their menu was different from what we're use to in Boston, normally there is more options for beef pho but from what I can recall they only had prime beef and meatball? Either way both dishes were delicious and authentic. If you want good Vietnamese in SF and don't want to wander around, waving at hookers in the Tenderloin area, come here instead!
author: Hung L.

description: I've eaten here a handful of times and it does not disappoint. The bun rieu is my favorite and it's packed with flavor. I've also ordered delivery here and they are really quick. Highly Recommend!
author: Nate R.

description: Great Pho, you can taste the freshness. Customer service is excellent. HIGHLY SUGGESTED.
author: Adrian A.

description: Truly incredible. The garlic noodles and chicken dish as well as the chicken pho were more than enough to ensure I will be coming back for many days to come. It is very very fairly priced too. Closed on Tuesday. That is a bit weird.
author: William A.

description: I have been wanting to come here for awhile and so glad I finally did today. Still feeling under the weather from Halloween festivities/ bender I was craving pho. Being the good yelper that I am I decided to venture out based on the reviews and try the Bun Rieu crab paste soup and OMGGGGGG so glad i did because I have a new favorite! This definitely hit the spot and was so flavorful, just wow. The broth is light yet filling and the meatballs have awesome juicy flavor, I loved the shallots or crunchy onions on top and the service was so nice and helpful. There is a Vietnamese place I go to by work where the workers are borderline mean to the patrons- these guys are such sweethearts, I've found my new favorite pho place :)
author: Sarah A.

description:
ordered through Eat24.

Got the pho with brisket, rare beef, and tendon with the 5 spiced chicken and a vietnamese coffee. i made sure to note no cilantro on the pho.

the food was surprisingly still warm and the coffee was warm enough.

the container with the soup had 3 meatballs, a nice bonus. i opened up the container with the toppings and found a mound of cilantro on top of the rare beef that was oddly wrapped in saran wrap, green onions, tendon, and noodles. (i don't know if there was any brisket in there now that i think about it.

i'm one of those people who think cilantro tastes like soap (i've read some people are genetically disposed) so i was disappointed that i had to pick out the cilantro (you can't completely get rid of all the flavor once it's in there) and pick out the tendon. even though there wasn't much in terms of meat and tendon, all in all it was a large helping of good tasting pho.

the chicken was delicious although a few bits were overcooked. still worth getting again.

vietnamese coffee was good but could've been watered down just a little since it was so sweet, although i know many people that would have said it's perfect.

i would order from here again.
author: Leonard A.

description: Fantastic! Ordered Pho for delivery and it came meticulously packed so the ingredients remained fresh! Imperial rolls were fine but the spring rolls (w/ shrimp) were large and amazing. They even gave us some Sriracha after we left a note in the delivery app!!
author: John D.

description: I love this place!  Today, instead of ordering my standard: the Chicken Pho, which I love, I decided to order the crab paste noodle soup. It is delicious!  A wonderful mix of crab and shrimp paste, ground pork, egg, fried tofu, tomato, shallot, scallion, cilantro, lime, bean sprouts and jalapeno.  Yumm!!  So flavorful with the right amount of texture and heat.  I am definitely going to order this again.
author: Ellen F.

description: Fresh, clean, and authentic. Our go to place for pho now. They also deliver for orders of $20+.
author: Michael T.

description: Love dining in or taking out from this place. Delicious and clean flavors. Never overly salted or spiced unlike most other Vietnamese restaurants that dump a ton of salt into their broth. All the ingredients are very fresh. This place is my go-to for satisfaction of my vietnamese food cravings.
author: Elly C.

description: The food here is authentic and fresh! Way better than Saiwalks, and they deliver quickly. The garlic noodles are to die for and my go-to "cheat day" meal if I'm having Vietnamese.
author: Alison Y.

description: Ly's is pretty good Americanized Vietnamese food. The five spice chicken with garlic noodles is tasty. Grilled shrimp plate had decent char and good flavor. Pho bowls are good, though one I went and though I ordered in the soup was not as hot as I liked. The staff did take it away and bring out a hotter bowl. Spring rolls were fresh, though the peanut sauce is a little thin. Is this place super authentic, maybe not but the food is tasty enough for the reasonable prices being charged and the portions are of good size. Not to mention, Ly's has a good health for score which is always a big plus in my book.
author: Lenneal G.

description: Cute little spot for Vietnamese food. Service was fast. Workers are nice and came by a lot more frequently than restaurants in L.A. I enjoyed their food. Worth to try.
author: Michelle S.

description: You'd drive right past this place on Lombard if you weren't looking but it's one of my favorite restaurants in all of SF. My friends and I have been here 50+ times over the last year and they never disappoint. I love supporting this family-owned restaurant - everyone is friendly and accommodating. Five stars on every visit.
author: Ana C.

description: I think the service and waiters are good I ordered Pho but compare with other restaurants the taste is not good!!!
author: Alex A.

description: Pho is really good, but they don't give that many vegetables for what you pay for. They need to give less noodles and more vegetables, then it would be perfect!
author: Shelby B.

description: Came here because I read the review was good but honestly this place is not worth it . I'm sorry it's not even good food im so disappointed in what I've ordered and what came out . I would have rather gone somewhere else to eat this was not worth my money . Try it urself. If I've never had good Vietnamese food before u might think this place is good but other wise I'm not happy with this place
author: Ashlee T.

description:
Bun Rieu is legit like my mom makes. The Bun thit nuong cha gio, has great meat, but they use spring mix and pineapple chunks which I think is pretty weird. The eggrolls in the bun thit nuong cha gio are pretty small. It is a good go to spot though because they deliver and are pretty consistent....and most other viet spots do not do Bun Rieu (the crab/seafood vermicelli) The Pho is on the good end..There are better out there, but this is not the worst spot by any means. 

Restaurant is clean, spacious and service is good. I would recommend this spot.
author: Jolie N.

description: Food was fantastic!  The Beef pho was some of the best I have tried. Order the pho beef combo!
author: Paul K.

description: Authentic and good. Hu thieu is solid, rice dishes are OK. Not going to change your world, but will definitely hit the spot whenever you want home style Vietnamese.
author: Chris P.

description: Tried the Crab Paste Soup, Beef Combo Pho, and egg rolls. Great service and great food!
author: Cindy K.

description: I was in dire need of pho one hangover morning and ordered the beef pho, 5 spiced chicken with garlic noodles, and Thai tea. Pho was very well packed and it was delicious after I heated up the broth. The garlic noodles + chicken dish is very tasty and hit the spot. I think the pho would probably taste better at the restaurant.
author: Jeanie L.

description: Awesome addition to the marina! A classic Vietnamese restaurant with pho, rice plates, and garlic noodle entrees! The garlic noodles are wonderful and the five spice chicken were both delicious. Service not too shabby. Will definitely be back!
author: Jennifer Hom C.

description: Five Spice Chicken. Potstickers. Thai Iced Tea. Coffee Flan. All equals a happy customer!
author: Richard R.

description: I had a very nice experience here! I enjoyed my crab paste noodle soup and vietnamese iced coffee. Very authentic and great flavors! My husband also enjoyed his rare steak Pho. Will be back when we come back to SF!
author: Kristy C.

description: This is a good place to find a vietnamese cuisine in san francisco..especially the pho
author: Handi S.

description: Decent is the best word - not bad, but nothing special - not really a lot of flavor, meat was given sparingly, and broth was also lackluster - no complaints but I won't be back.
author: Tamas G.

description: Best little hidden gem for Pho! Excellent customer service and food. Super cute family run restaurant. Staff is very attentive and even let us walk in when it was closing time! They have a family dinner at the end of every night with the entire staff :)
author: Haein Y.

description: I was looking for Vietnamese restaurant near my place, and Ly's was the closest. I had beef pho with tendon added. Their broth has good taste and the price..? AMAZING. Hard to find such affordable eat out. Only problem i had was tendon. It was not tender enough for me to swallow. I had to chew on it several times. Next time i visit, i'll prob order beef pho with brisket added instead of tendon.
author: Sm Y.

description: Fam and I ordered a garlic noodle plate and two phos (crab paste and one with meatballs). Garlic noodle with veggies came out promptly, yet we had to wait another 15 minutes to get our soups. Nothing redeeming about the soups other than it was hot and noodles were in it. They kept our water filled though and atmosphere is casual and cute. I would not recommend anyone here, regardless of whether they were pho connoisseurs or not.
author: Cami G.

description: Great service -- this was our 4th time to get delivery and it has been consistent each time. The garlic noodles are always a favorite and the price to add more items is reasonable.
author: Todd G.

description: The rating that this place has received is much too high for the quality of food it produces.
author: M M.

description: Sooooo happy an authentic Vietnamese restaurant opened in the marina!!! This review is super overdue since I've been coming here almost once a week since their grand opening. Everyone who works there is so nice and the food is delicious! Highly recommended!!! :)
author: Heather C.

description:
Our group of four ordered the beef pho, spring rolls (summer rolls) and the rice and beef plates. Food was good overall but there were a few misses:

1)We ordered two bowls of pho and I had to ask for the garnishes (sprouts, basil, lime, jalapeños). I was then presented with the stingiest amount I have ever seen. Meanwhile the table across from us received a far more generous garnish plate and they didn't even have to ask for it. the noodles were also in a giant clump sitting in the bowl.

2)The summer rolls here are called spring rolls but they are wrapped in the rice wrappers, not deep fried. Mostly lettuce filled, not generous with the other ingredients. Might just be me but I prefer the ones with shrimp and a thin layer of pork.

3)Between the rice with beef and the rice with filet mignon, the regular beef was actually more flavorful though thin sliced not cut into chunks.

good cheap eats.
author: S D.

description: I ordered delivery through EAT24 and my food arrived within 45 minutes. Everything was delicious and Ly's prices are totally reasonable. I recommend the imperial rolls, the rare beef pho, the garlic noodles and the sautéed string beans.
author: Sasha A.

description:
We went for dinner here this past week on a rainy week night for a delicious bowl of pho. I have been trying to find good Vietnamese in the city and this will be my new go to. 

The restaurant is low key but very clean with a great streamlined menu. We shared the spring rolls with shrimp to start and each ordered the rare beef pho and added the meatballs at the waitress's recommendation. Everything was delicious but I don't think the meatballs were a necessary addition (I am not a huge meat eater).
author: Leah S.

description: The cuisine is family owned and we experienced such great customer service. The broth in the beef pho was very tasty and the temperature was hot. I usually add a good amount of sriracha and hoison sauce but this time I drizzled a little - that's how flavorful the soup is. Thank you - I'll be back soon. The server mentioned that their chicken broth is very popular so I'll be trying that the next time.
author: Isela E.

description: Good food,but nothing special. I had crab paste Phō. The Vietnamese coffe was bad though. Had it in other places and it's been much better. Prices are good,the place is okay,but maybe more of a takeaway place?
author: Alexander R.

description: Excellent rare beef pho.  Broth is great.  Also had the five spice garlic noodles.  Loved the noodles, thought the chicken could have more flavor.  But great.    Fast and good value.
author: David S.

description: The food is quite tasty. The price is average for the city but VERY good for the Marina area. The only problem that I have is that the restaurant is 1 block away from my location and it always takes over an hour to deliver and they always manage to just SLIGHTLY mess up my order. Nothing so much so that it makes it a deal breaker but enough that I say "Oh, man.. that sucks" every time they drop off my food.
author: Mandy R.

description:
I am so happy to find a Pho place in the Marina. 
The food is ok but nothing to rave about.  

The pho is ok for the Marina. Good amount of meat but the broth is mediocore. If you want good beef pho, head over to the Tenderloin.  Even Slanted Door in the mall has better pho (as Americanized as it gets). For good chicken pho, just go to turtle tower as it's always consistent. 

Pros:  service is good and it's a clean pho place
Cons:  food wasn't piping hot, soup base could be better, they could add more noodles 

We don't have many options in the Marina so this is as good as it gets if you want something in the area.  I'm really hoping this place gets better!!!!
author: VIOLA L.

description: A much needed pho place in the Marina. Broth was perfect, hot and not too salty. Brisket and rare beef were cooked/uncooked well and there were good amounts of both. Service was quick and friendly. Will definitely be back!
author: Ning T.

description: This place is nice and clean. The service is good, too. The beef spring rolls are incredibly delicious! We also ordered pho and tomato seafood pho (I forgot the name). I love them both!!!
author: Wensi Z.

description:
We came in on a wintery day and were warmly welcome!
It's a simple place with simple yet delicious, honey Viatnamese food, freshly prepared. Don't miss the pho, the spring rolls and the wings!
author: Udi P.

description:
Good food.. Reasonable prices. Got the grilled pork with rice and fried egg ($9)Very Good! My friend got the 5 spice chicken over the garlic noodles and said it was delicious(also $9). We had leftovers.. I'm  definitely coming back!! 

They deliver as well. Think it's free but there's a minimum $ order.
author: Louisa D.

description:
The New Best Pho in SF !!!
The grand new opening and I wanted to give it a try. As a result, I am glad that I did. This will be my new favorite place to get Pho in SF. The people who work here are very pleasant and friendly. Most importantly, their service is quick and the food is tasty.
Highly recommended. A must-try place. Won't disappoint!!
Long story short: Fair price, good food, and great customer service. I definitely will return!!.
author: Quoc N.

description: Excellent! Such a great new place in the neighborhood, very friendly owners & super clean restaurant. If you like Vietnamese food, I'd recommend you try this place. :)
author: Kate G.

description: I found the food here very salty. You're better off getting authentic pho broth in the loin, sunset or china town (golden star is my favorite).
author: Katherine S.

description: The best Pho I have ever had. I usually get the vegetable pho and it is quite a big portion. The service is a bit slow and it truly sucks when you are very hungry. Overall great Pho place. Very Clean and everyone is very nice.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Strongly recommend the Papaya and shrimp salad. It was fantastic! 
My husband liked the five spicy chicken very much.
author: Jingyi W.

description: Solid Pho Thai Chin and Bún thit nuong cha giò. Fast delivery.
author: Michael T.

description: Good stuff.    Family friendly down-home Vietnamese restaurant for the Marina.   Everything we had was delicious and service is fantastic.
author: Super T.

description: I stumbled upon Ly's today and so glad I did!! They have the best chicken pho that is so rich in flavor. Their spring rolls and 5 spice chicken with noodles are also incredibly delicious. Absolutely coming back!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Good food but no Pokestop anywhere nearby.... Couldn't play PoGO while here. But food was decent
author: Peter T.

description: I never even liked Pho until I had it at Ly's. The chicken pho specifically is better than any I've ever had and you can't beat $9 for a huge bowl of deliciousness. Haven't tried anything else yet but it all looks great!
author: Carly K.

description: We always go to Ly's when a pho craving hits. Reliable tasty broth and friendly service!
author: Melissa G.

description: Really amazing food. Try the Chicken Pho and Imperial spring rolls. Cheap as chips but well worth trying.
author: Stephen B.

description: This place doesn't have much of an ambience - perhaps because they've only recently opened and haven't done a lot of decorating. But the garlic noodles are probably the best I've ever had, and the price was very reasonable. Check out this place if you're in to Vietnamese.
author: Andy J.

description: Just had the garlic noodle and bbq pork. Awesome and friendly service. I'll be back again on my next vacation.
author: David O.

description: This place has good pho. The folks here use a very authentic recipe and it's excellent for the price. I definitely plan on eating here again soon!
author: Shawn H.

description: If you visit SF you should come to Ly's restaurant .  It's clean and best service , of course the foods are very good too. Especially the Pho noodle soup  and I loved the garlic noodle and chicken . Can't wait to come back there again.
author: Phuong N.

description: They are friendly and the 5 spice chicken is nice and crispy. yummie to my tummie! go there and support your local biz shops! LoveLy place to dine and have lunch - the atmosphere is modern and sleek.
author: Thang D.

description: Finally! A GOOD Vietnamese restaurant in the Marina.  I was hesitant at first because of the prior Vietnamese place that was there before.  I made an order for delivery, the person that took my order was very nice and courteous.  I ordered Banh xeo, combo pho and rice with grill pork.  The order arrived less than 30 minutes with a smile.  Everything was very flavorful and delicious.  The greens that came with the food was very very fresh, a plus in my book. I am very happy with my overall experience.  I will definitely be a repeat customer.
author: Uy D.

description: Great customer service and the food was also good. I would recommend this to all my friends who crave Vietnamese cuisine.. If your ever on Lombard street a must visit..
author: Ron T.

description: Very good, fresh Vietnamese; the staff is very friendly, the place is spotless, and the food came very fast. Highly recommended.
author: Tim A.

description:
The Real Deal!

I have tried several other Pho restaurants in SF and have been very disappointed.

Ly's, on the other hand, has very delicious, hearty Pho. I added a little bit of Sriracha and the veggies and that was all it needed to be very flavorful. Do yourself a favor and don't waste your money at some of these other places. This place has great food!

***Update!**** 
I went there a second time and the Pho was (maybe) a little bit better than the first time. Their consistency seems to be good, which sometimes is hard to find in a Pho restaurant. My wife came with me this time (she is from Vietnam) and her words were "This tastes like home".
author: Timothy C.

description: Great FOODDD and great customer service!! There Pho is amazing!!! I definitely recommend this place!
author: Joshua P. J.

description: Head here for the perfect lunch. The Pho soup was really good. The drip coffee was not as good as it should be from Vietnam.
author: Per E.

description: The beef combo pho and spring roll are delicious. The soup of pho is nice. The c/p is good.
author: Siyat U.

description: Was here on their grand opening, ordered the Crab Paste noodle soup, it was actually pretty good. It certainly pack a lot more flavor than the ones I had so far. Would definitely come back and try another dish.
author: Dewey H.

description: What happened to those good reviews  on this restaurant? My husband and I did not have a good experience eating here last night. We ordered the garlic noodles and it's locking up garlic, I cannot even say it's a garlic noodles as it does not have any flavor of garlic at all. perhaps my taste buds was not  good last night as the spice chicken similarly was kind of  tough  it tasted like it was reheated several times and it was room temperature when It reach our table. The spring roll was so so. Maybe their cook was off last night. Since we don't have the same experience as the other customers  or maybe my standard is just really high, judge it yourself
author: Dibina F.

description: Great new vietnamese restaurant with delicious food; friendly and professional service!!!!
author: Jenny L.

description: I'm a regular here. Best pho by far. I recently made the mistake of going to hunan empire on Union for my soup craving. Will never wast my money again. Lys has amazing pho and super cheap.
author: Genevieve F.

description:
4.5 Stars

I commute into SF and stay near Ly's on Lombard. The restaurant opened in June, 20515, taking over a rather dull and not very good restaurant.

I have eaten there twice and WOW. Great place, wonderful and friendly service and decent prices. 

The first meal was the wing appetizers, GREAT and fresh spring rolls and papaya salad. YUMMY!

I was back this week and tried the Pho / combo bowl. While not quite as good as other places I have tried, was very tasty and filling. 

The place seems to be family run and the staff is very friendly. 

Check it out, for sure!!
author: W M.

description: 5 spice chicken was good. Flavorful but not spicy hot. The grilled beef rice plat was good. Good flavor without being overpowered. Cafe sua da was okay. There was a bit of bitterness from the coffee the came through the mild sweetness from the condensed milk. I would come back without hesitation if I'm back in the area.
author: Earl M.

description:
I am soo excited! I eat pho 2 times a week or so and this place just opened near my house. It is some of the best I have had in San Fran (ok maybe the best). I don't understand how I got so lucky. Life changed.

The service was also very nice and the new owners are very enthusiastic :)
author: Laura S.

description: I don't know what so great about this place. Service was just ok and food was below my standards  for authentic  Vietnamese food. Was Luke warm and not very flavorful. Had to ask for more  water and even then waited a while. Maybe it's an off night, but we were sadly dissapointed.
author: Clyde C.

description: Good pho.  Very good steak -- recommend the regular grilled steak as even tastier than the filet mignon.  Simple, clean room -- a bit stark for the Marina / Cow Hollow but what you really expect for a pho joint.
author: Matthew D.

description: We are visiting San Francisco and discovered this amazing restaurant. The food was incredible. I had the vermicelli salad with pork. This is my usual back home. At Ly's it was amazing. The pork was tender and flavorful. We also had the crepe which we know as a pancake. It was more crispy than we are used to but again, delicious. Wish we lived closer.
author: Kimberly W.

description: Great hidden place in the Maria district. Very reasonable price and super nice services.  Give this place a try and you will not be disappointed
author: Sw W.

description: My bf and I were excited to eat Vietnamese food for breakfast/lunch. We waited for about 30 minutes for the waitress to come to our table. 4 people came after us and they were eating their food. We hadn't even ordered yet. I don't know why we were mistreated like that. We ended up leaving.
author: Carolina M.

description: This place is amazing! I usually call in orders to pick up and they're always so friendly and have my food ready to pick up in a timely matter. Their rare beef pho is really good with a good portion size and great price. This is my go to place for pho and I will continue to keep coming back here. Highly recommended for their friendly service and amazing pho!
author: Ericka C.

description: great food! as advertised, the pho broth was great, crab cake noodles was amazing and the garlic noodles with filet mignon was "the best I ever tasted" according to a friend.  Courteous staff and great customer service.
author: Brian H.

description: Fantastic beef pho!!! Can't wait to try the other menu items. Delivery estimate was 45 minutes and my food arrived pipping hot in 25 minutes. So glad I came across the place!
author: Max F.

description: Great! Loved the papaya salad! Would definitely recommend!
author: Erin W.

description: Great new reasonably priced spot. The staff is prompt and very friendly. Becoming a regular . . . .
author: Dan J.

description: Pho came in a good size serving and the price was great.  Place was really busy with pickups and deliveries so that must mean the place is a favorite of the locals.
author: nima s.

description: The chicken pho is amazing!So are the garlic noodles!!!! Very good service and friendly staff!!!!!!
author: Sarah R.

description: Awesome.  Have gotten delivery from here multiple times.  Not within delivery range according to eat24, but called and they have no prob delivering, and people that answer the phone are great.  Fantastic five spice chicken and garlic noodles.  Angel wings are solid, and their pho is LEGIT, and surprisingly legit for delivery... you have to add all the ingredients to the broth, but they package it really well.  Meat and veggies fresh, broth VERY hot when it arrives.  Quickly became my go-to for Vietnamese delivery.. prices are excellent.  Need to to try spring rolls and shaking beef next-- I shall report back.
author: Chris M.

description: I love Pho and PPQ in Sunset is where I go to get my fix.  I wanted to give this place a try seeing the high rating on Yelp and I was so disappointed.  Four of us ordered imperial roll, Crab paste noodle soup, garlic noodle with five spice chicken, rice with five spice chicken, and grilled shrimp pho.  The Crab paste noodle soup was just okay and vermicilli in it was over cooked.  The grilled shrimps came with the pho were puny, barely 2 inches long scattered sadly in the mostly empty plate.  The portion for the five spice chicken was small and tasted bland.  Then the imperial rolls!  the waiter delivered to the wrong table and did not realize until we asked (the restaurant was not busy at all).  We were almost done with our food when the rolls came and the outside was stale and inside was mushy.  I did not know that one can mess up Vietnamese comfort food this badly.  I don't understand why its rating is so high either. Perhaps they had a bad day when we visited.
author: Wes M.

description: Great food, friendly staff. Imperial rolls are made in-house and are delicious. Five spice chicken garlic noodles were very good. Reasonable prices for reasonably sized portions.
author: Heidi S.

description: I have been looking for good Pho in the Marina ever since I moved (LOVED Pho Vet in San Rafael) and I found it.  No frills, no "vibe", just a great big bowl of delicious Pho at a very good price.  I do veggie (which is NOT always that great) and they did not disappoint.  The servers were adorable and very friendly (you could tell they either owned or were related to the owner).
author: laurel f.

description: The people there were so nice! Very friendly and hospitable. They gave us a free dessert and extra mints. They also allowed combinations and changes to meals. My boyfriend has a severe peanut allergy and they were very informative of his options. It was very clean and the food arrived fairly quickly. The food was tasty and healthy and left me feeling satisfied but not overly stuffed. I would definitely come back again and recommend it to my friends!
author: Anna D.

description: 5 of us met here for lunch. Everyone comments on the decor, I thought it was perfect. Quiet, not gaudy, robins egg colored chairs. We couldn't get ice for our drinks which seems to be a Cali problem, in RI you usually get too much ice! We ordered potstickers, nim chow(called something different here, the rice paper wrapped shrimp), beef pho, shrimp plate, beef plate, and shrimp paste soup. The beef pho was good, average; more than enough for two people. Potstickers were gently fried (I think) had a slight crust and were excellent. The nim chows were excellent, more complex than I get at home. The shrimp came with greens, rice and a fried egg. Looked great, I didn't get to try. My mother didn't eat much of her soup, but I think she got full. I ate it for a few days, the shrimp paste gave it a great depth of flavor. I also reheated my brothers beef strip plate, I think that was my favorite dish. If you are here and you only like traditional American Chinese food this is what you should order. The food was very 'clean' as I would call it, not greasy.
author: C M.

description: Fantastic! A must if you are looking for good Vietnamese food. We went as a party of four and each of us were delighted with our selections.   The spring rolls were fresh,  delicious and were served with a creamy peanut sauce.  The serving was generous, (4 ample rolls) and easily could be shared. The Vietnamese crepe was crispy and was filled with shrimp and pork served with a generous amount of fresh leaf lettuce for wrapping. It was delicious. The papaya salad was also a generous portion and was fresh and tasty . The vermicelli bowl with pork was my entree. My wife had the same thing only with shrimp. We were very pleased. Both entrées were cool ,refreshing and served with a delicious fish oil dressing.. The wait staff were attentive,very eager to please and friendly. The waitress even insisted on bringing our table a sample of their signature dish which is garlic noodles. Oh, and did I mention the very reasonable prices? Our party of 4 ate our fill,took home doggie bags and our bill was under $80. Please do yourself a favor and try this restaurant.
author: Jim R.
